TEXT:
Der Grand-Prix in Suzuka, Japan | Martin Rose via Getty Images

Am Sonntagmorgen findet der Grand-Prix in Suzuka statt - auch im Live-Stream

Die Ãœbertragung des Rennen startet um 7 Uhr mitteleuropÃ¤ischer Zeit

Das Video oben zeigt, wie ihr die Formel 1 im Live-Stream sehen kÃ¶nnt

Formel 1 im Live-Stream: Der Grand-Prix der Formel 1 findet am Sonntag in Japan statt. Sebastian Vettel kÃ¶nnte mit einem Podestplatz in Japan zu Fernando Alonso in der ewigen Formel-1-Bestenliste aufschlieÃŸen.

Landet der Ferrari-Fahrer am Sonntag in Suzuka unter den ersten drei Piloten, hÃ¤tte er es zum 97. Mal auf's Treppchen geschafft. Alonso belegt derzeit den vierten Platz.

â–º Den Rekord hÃ¤lt aber auch hier der siebenmalige Weltmeister Michael Schumacher, der es in 155 Grand-Prix unter die besten Drei schaffte.

Vom Regen ausgebremst

Das Freitagstraining fÃ¼r den Grand-Prix mussten die Piloten der Formel 1 im Dauerregen abhalten. Nach der Bestzeit des deutschen Ferrari-Fahrers im Auftakttraining sicherte sich der britische Mercedes-Pilot die schnellste Runde in einer nassen Mini-Einheit.

â€œIm zweiten Training war viel Regen, es hat sich aber sehr wichtig angefÃ¼hlt da rauszugehen, um die Strecke einschÃ¤tzen zu kÃ¶nnen und zu sehen, wie sich das Auto anfÃ¼hltâ€, sagte WM-Spitzenreiter Hamilton nach seiner vier Runden langen Nassfahrt. â€œDer Wagen fÃ¼hlt sich wieder normal an, ich bin bereit zu fahren.â€

Wie ihr den GroÃŸen Preis von Japan im Live-Stream sehen kÃ¶nnt

Der Free-TV-Sender RTL Ã¼bertrÃ¤gt das Rennen live im Fernsehen. Die Ãœbertragung startet um 7 Uhr MEZ. Im Pay-TV Ã¼bertrÃ¤gt Sky Sport 1 den Grand-Prix.

Wer die Formel 1 im Internet verfolgen will, kann das auf den Internetportalen "Sky Go" und â€œTVnowâ€ tun. Beide erfordern aber ein kostenpflichtiges Abonnement:

â–º RTL im Live-Stream (Nur mit Abo)

â–º Suzuka-Qualifying auf Sky Go (Nur mit Abo)

Sebastian Vettel gibt sich siegessicher

Vor dem fÃ¼nftletzten Grand-Prix der Saison liegt der zuletzt von Pech und Pleiten verfolgte Hesse 34 Punkte hinter seinem Kontrahenten Hamilton.

An der Zuversicht Vettels Ã¤ndert das nichts. â€œIch glaube, wir sind stark, wir haben allen Grund, selbstbewusst zu seinâ€, beteuerte der 30-JÃ¤hrige. â€œIch bin mir ziemlich sicher, wir kÃ¶nnen am Sonntag zeigen, was wir kÃ¶nnen.â€

Lewis Hamilton hat gute Chancen auf den WM-Titel

Seine starke Form will Hamilton weiter unter Beweis stellen. Die ersten drei Rennen nach der Sommerpause gewann der 32-JÃ¤hrige, zuletzt sicherte er sich in Malaysia mit seinem bisweilen stÃ¶rrischen Silberpfeil Position zwei.

â€œIch will dieses Ding einfach gewinnenâ€, betonte Hamilton, der auf seinen vierten WM-Titel zusteuern will. â€œVielleicht habe ich den Nagel schon ein bisschen eingeschlagen, ich muss aber weiter draufhauen.â€

â¨ Das kÃ¶nnte euch auch interessieren: Michael Schumacher ist in der Hall of Fame des deutschen Sports

(Mit Material der dpa)

Angebot: FÃ¼r alle, die aktiv werden wollen - zum Beispiel mit FuÃŸball:

Angebot: DAZN bietet seinen Abonnenten die Highlights der 1. Bundesliga in der Zusammenfassung an. â¨ Hier kÃ¶nnt ihr euren Gratismonat starten Danach beginnt ein kostenpflichtiges Abonnement.

(luca)
TITLE: Formel 1 im Live-Stream: GroÃŸer Preis von Japan online sehen - so geht's

SUMMARY:
Three recent PSAs show just how illogical victim-blaming behavior really is.
Each video features an ordinary setting in which one character uses victim-blaming behavior to excuse their problematic actions, similar to the victim-blaming actions in cases of sexual assault.
The three clips show a wedding cake baker appreciating his newest creation, two young women perusing an art gallery and a toilet bowl salesman who gets an unlikely surprise from a customer who needs to go to the bathroom.
In the PSA below, a woman approaches a wedding cake baker to compliment his beautiful cake.
When the baker, who looks absolutely horrified, asks why she would ruin his cake, the woman responds: â€œOh come on.
TEXT:
Three recent PSAs show just how illogical victim-blaming behavior really is.

Created by 101-North Marketing in partnership with former Vice President Joe Bidenâ€™s Itâ€™s On Us organization, the three PSAs are each around one minute long. Each video features an ordinary setting in which one character uses victim-blaming behavior to excuse their problematic actions, similar to the victim-blaming actions in cases of sexual assault.

The PSAs were published earlier this month but recently got more attention when model and womenâ€™s advocate Amber Rose posted one to her Instagram.

The three clips show a wedding cake baker appreciating his newest creation, two young women perusing an art gallery and a toilet bowl salesman who gets an unlikely surprise from a customer who needs to go to the bathroom.

In the PSA below, a woman approaches a wedding cake baker to compliment his beautiful cake.

A post shared by Amber Rose (@amberrose) on Sep 24, 2017 at 2:36pm PDT

â€œWow that is a beautiful cake. Did you make it? It looks so delicious!â€ the woman exclaims before taking a huge handful to eat.

When the baker, who looks absolutely horrified, asks why she would ruin his cake, the woman responds: â€œOh come on. You knew what you were doing, you were the one that made it so tempting. Tahitian vanilla icing and pretty little flowers? Itâ€™s like you were begging me to taste it.â€

At the end of each PSA, these words appear on the screen: â€œThis is the logic used to excuse sexual assault. Not very logical, is it?â€
TITLE: This Is How Victim-Blaming Logic Would Play Out In Everyday Scenarios

SUMMARY:
Die SPD macht sich einfach vom AckerNatÃ¼rlich kann keine Partei gezwungen werden, in eine Regierung einzutreten, Verantwortung zu Ã¼bernehmen, gegebenenfalls auch die PrÃ¼gel fÃ¼r unpopulÃ¤re, aber unumgÃ¤ngliche Entscheidungen einzustecken.
Auch die GrÃ¼nen und Die Linke alias PDS haben einst als Protestparteien angefangen.
Und die SPD?
Irgendwie scheint die SPD selbst zu spÃ¼ren, dass ihre BegrÃ¼ndung, warum sie sich einfach vom Acker macht, nicht sehr glaubwÃ¼rdig ist.
Als die Linke vor vier Jahren erstmals einen Sitz mehr hatte als die GrÃ¼nen, rief sich der groÃŸe Taktiker Gysi zum OppositionsfÃ¼hrer aus.
TEXT:
Die Stimmen waren am 24. September kurz nach 18 Uhr noch nicht ausgezÃ¤hlt, da lieÃŸ die SPD ihre WÃ¤hler und die gesamte Ã–ffentlichkeit wissen: Ihr habt uns ein so schlechtes Ergebnis beschert, dass wir uns fÃ¼r nichts und niemanden mehr verantwortlich fÃ¼hlen. Deshalb gehen wir in die Opposition. Macht euren Dreck alleene. Basta.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Historisch schlechtes Wahlergebnis: SPD will in die Opposition gehen

Seitdem intonieren alle SPD-GrÃ¶ÃŸen dieselbe Melodie. Die 20,5 Prozent waren eine Absage an die GroÃŸe Koalition. Deshalb werden wir auf keinen Fall eine neue eingehen. Opposition ist nicht mehr Mist, wie einst Franz MÃ¼ntefering meinte, sondern sozusagen die KrÃ¶nung parteipolitischer Existenz. Mit uns zieht die neue Zeit: Erst die Partei, dann der Staat.

Die SPD macht sich einfach vom Acker

NatÃ¼rlich kann keine Partei gezwungen werden, in eine Regierung einzutreten, Verantwortung zu Ã¼bernehmen, gegebenenfalls auch die PrÃ¼gel fÃ¼r unpopulÃ¤re, aber unumgÃ¤ngliche Entscheidungen einzustecken. Auch reine Protestparteien wirken an der politischen Willensbildung mit und erfÃ¼llen insofern einen Auftrag des Grundgesetzes.

Doch es gibt eben einen Unterschied zwischen Parteien, die WutbÃ¼rger und WutwÃ¤hler einsammeln, um es den "Altparteien" mal so richtig zu zeigen, und Gestaltungsparteien, die Verantwortung fÃ¼r Staat und Gesellschaft Ã¼bernehmen. Auch die GrÃ¼nen und Die Linke alias PDS haben einst als Protestparteien angefangen. Heute wollen sie ganz selbstverstÃ¤ndlich regieren.

Die AfD verkÃ¶rpert den Typus der Protestpartei geradezu perfekt. Und die SPD? Die alte Volkspartei, die immer bereit war, Verantwortung zu Ã¼bernehmen - schon im Kaiserreich, dann in der Weimarer Republik und schlieÃŸlich in der Bundesrepublik? Die wandelt sich unter ihrem entzauberten Gottkanzler Martin Schulz zur Ohne-mich-Truppe. Die SPD macht sich einfach vom Acker.

Ja, die GroKo ist vom WÃ¤hler nicht bestÃ¤tigt worden. Der Anteil der drei Parteien CDU, SPD und CSU ist von 67 Prozent im Jahr 2013 auf 53 Prozent geschrumpft. Gleichwohl: Auch jetzt verfÃ¼gt Schwarz-Rot noch deutlich Ã¼ber mehr als die HÃ¤lfte der Sitze. Dass die GroKo also kein Mandat mehr hÃ¤tte, stimmt einfach nicht.

Union hat noch mehr verloren

Die Kanzlerin sei "die grÃ¶ÃŸte Verliererin", fauchte er am Wahlabend in der Elefantenrunde. Das stimmt sogar: Der RÃ¼ckgang der CDU/CSU von 41,5 auf 32,9 Prozent entspricht einem Minus von 8,6 Prozentpunkten oder 20,7 Prozent. Bei der SPD fÃ¼hrt der RÃ¼ckgang von 25,7 auf 20,5 Prozent zu einem Minus von 20,2 Prozent. Schulz hat also recht: Die Union hat noch etwas mehr verloren als seine eigene Partei.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: "Merkels SchrÃ¶der-Moment": Warum der CDU ein Absturz wie der SPD droht

Doch Schulz' Schlussfolgerung ist nicht nachvollziehbar. Weil die Sozialdemokraten 20,2 Prozent eingebÃ¼ÃŸt haben, haben sie angeblich kein Regierungsmandat mehr. Die CDU/CSU hingegen mit einem etwas grÃ¶ÃŸeren Minus von 20,7 Prozent soll und muss regieren? Wo bleibt da die Logik, Herr Schulz?

Irgendwie scheint die SPD selbst zu spÃ¼ren, dass ihre BegrÃ¼ndung, warum sie sich einfach vom Acker macht, nicht sehr glaubwÃ¼rdig ist. Also wird der Vorrang der Protest-Politik vor der Verantwortungs-Politik staatspolitisch verbrÃ¤mt. Es gelte, die AfD als "OppositionsfÃ¼hrerin" zu verhindern. Denn sollten Union und SPD abermals koalieren, kÃ¤me diese Rolle der AfD als drittstÃ¤rkster Kraft zu.

Flucht aus der Verantwortung

Das Problem ist nur: Die GeschÃ¤ftsordnung des Parlaments kennt eine besondere Rolle der "OppositionsfÃ¼hrerin" gar nicht. Redezeiten und Ausschussvorsitze werden strikt nach der GrÃ¶ÃŸe der Fraktionen vergeben, ganz gleich, ob eine Fraktion die Regierung stÃ¼tzt oder gegen sie opponiert. Wer stÃ¤rkste Oppositionsfraktion ist, macht sich vor allem in der Reihenfolge der Redner bemerkbar.

Auf eine Rede des Kanzlers oder der Kanzlerin darf die stÃ¤rkste Oppositionsfraktion zuerst antworten; sie darf bestimmte Debatten auch erÃ¶ffnen. Das bekommt auÃŸerhalb des Parlaments jedoch kaum jemand mit. Was in den Fernsehnachrichten aus dem Parlament gesendet und was in den Zeitungen berichtet wird, bestimmt sich nie nach der Reihenfolge der Redner.

"OppositionsfÃ¼hrer", das ist in gewisser Weise eine Erfindung von Gregor Gysi. Als die Linke vor vier Jahren erstmals einen Sitz mehr hatte als die GrÃ¼nen, rief sich der groÃŸe Taktiker Gysi zum OppositionsfÃ¼hrer aus. Er fÃ¼llte diese Rolle auch aus. Aber nicht dank seines Status, sondern weil er einer der besten Redner unter der Reichstagskuppel war und ist.

Seine beiden Nachfolger an der Spitze der Linke-Fraktion, Sahra Wagenknecht und Dietmar Bartsch, fielen da weniger auf - auch wenn sie gelegentlich direkt auf Angela Merkel antworten konnten.

Da mÃ¶gen Martin Schulz und Genossen erzÃ¤hlen was sie wollen: Ihr Drang in die Opposition ist eine Flucht aus der Verantwortung. Mit dem Kampf gegen â€die Nazis", wie Schulz die Auseinandersetzung mit der AfD nennt, hat das nichts zu tun. Der gescheiterte Kanzlerkandidat Schulz will seine Position als SPD-Vorsitzender retten.

Sein Dreiklang lautet so: Erstens die Person, zweitens die Partei, drittens das Land. Das sind neue TÃ¶ne. Man kÃ¶nnte auch im neuen SPD-Sound sagen: Das Land bekommt eins "in die Fresse"
TITLE: Keine GroKo, lieber Opposition: Die SPD macht es sich nach ihrer Niederlage zu leicht

SUMMARY:
Indian residents of Siliguri protest against the gang rape of a nun at a Christian missionary school.
ADVERTISEMENTUTTAR PRADESH-- A 30-year-old woman was gang raped by four men in front of her husband and infant son in Muzaffarnagar in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Saturday.
The criminals intercepted the family which was on a bike on a deserted stretch of road and dragged them to a sugarcane field.
They tied her husband to a tree and threatened to harm their child if they raised an alarm, the victim told the police.
They then reportedly took turns to rape the woman.
TEXT:
Indian residents of Siliguri protest against the gang rape of a nun at a Christian missionary school.

ADVERTISEMENT

UTTAR PRADESH-- A 30-year-old woman was gang raped by four men in front of her husband and infant son in Muzaffarnagar in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Saturday.

The criminals intercepted the family which was on a bike on a deserted stretch of road and dragged them to a sugarcane field. They tied her husband to a tree and threatened to harm their child if they raised an alarm, the victim told the police.

They then reportedly took turns to rape the woman.

The attack took place when the victim and her family was on their way back from a doctor's clinic after a medical check up of their child.

Farmers from a nearby field heard their cries for help and came to their rescue but the four men had escaped by then.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: A Woman Was Allegedly Gangraped In Muzaffarnagar In Front Of Her Husband And 2-Year-Old Son

TEXT:
POOL New / Reuters

JUSTICE - Le parquet national financier (PNF) requiert le renvoi devant un tribunal correctionnel de l'ancien prÃ©sident Nicolas Sarkozy ainsi que de son avocat et d'un ex-magistrat dans l'affaire dite des Ã©coutes, a rÃ©vÃ©lÃ© ce vendredi 6 octobre le quotidien Le Parisien.

Selon le journal, le parquet rÃ©clame un procÃ¨s contre l'ancien chef de l'Etat pour "corruption, trafic d'influence et recel de violation du secret professionnel". Il demande Ã©galement le renvoi de son avocat Thierry Herzog et de l'avocat gÃ©nÃ©ral, dÃ©sormais Ã  la retraite, Gilbert Azibert, Ã©galement mis en examen dans ce dossier ouvert il y a plus de trois ans.

La procureur Eliane Houlette a signÃ© jeudi ce rÃ©quisitoire, qui n'a pas encore Ã©tÃ© notifiÃ© aux principaux intÃ©ressÃ©s, affirme Le Parisien. Il revient dÃ©sormais aux juges d'instruction de prendre leur dÃ©cision.

"Force est de constater que le rÃ©quisitoire a Ã©tÃ© diffusÃ© dans la presse avant mÃªme d'avoir Ã©tÃ© portÃ© Ã  la connaissance des parties", ont rÃ©agi les avocats de l'ancien prÃ©sident, Jacqueline Laffont et Pierre HaÃ¯k, auprÃ¨s de l'AFP. "C'est assez regrettable et cocasse dans une procÃ©dure dans laquelle des violations du secret de l'enquÃªte et de l'instruction ont Ã©tÃ© reprochÃ©es", ont-ils ajoutÃ©.

Nicolas Sarkozy, dÃ©jÃ  renvoyÃ© devant le tribunal dans une autre affaire, est soupÃ§onnÃ© dans ce dossier d'avoir tentÃ© d'obtenir en 2014, via son avocat Thierry Herzog, des informations secrÃ¨tes auprÃ¨s d'un haut magistrat de la Cour de cassation, Gilbert Azibert, dans une procÃ©dure oÃ¹ il demandait la restitution de ses agendas saisis dans l'affaire Bettencourt. Une affaire qui s'est soldÃ©e pour lui par un non-lieu en 2013.

EnquÃªte bouclÃ©e il y a un an

A l'origine de l'affaire, des Ã©coutes tÃ©lÃ©phoniques de l'ancien prÃ©sident ordonnÃ©es dans une autre enquÃªte, celle sur les accusations de financement libyen de sa campagne de 2007.

Dans les conversations avec son avocat, Nicolas Sarkozy semble s'engager Ã  intervenir en faveur du magistrat pour qu'il obtienne un poste de prestige Ã  Monaco. SUMMARY:
Medical experts call this common ailment hypochlorhydria, but anyone experiencing its symptoms will likely describe it in much simpler terms: a nagging pain in the gut.
People with auto-immune conditions or food sensitivities and intolerances can be particularly vulnerable.
They include abdominal pain, heartburn, nausea, gas, bloating, constipation and even vomiting of sour liquid known as "water brash."
Today's integrative medicine professionals are taking a different approach.
While that pain in the gut might seem temporary and easy enough to self-medicate with a simple tablet, hypochlorhydria and its implications for worsening health should be treated with great care.
TEXT:
Medical experts call this common ailment hypochlorhydria, but anyone experiencing its symptoms will likely describe it in much simpler terms: a nagging pain in the gut.

Hypochlorhydria is a familiar condition today, one caused by decreased levels of hydrochloric acid (HCl), an essential stomach or gastric acid that, under ideal conditions, performs two very significant functions in the human body. HCl initiates the breakdown of proteins that we ingest and it activates the enzyme pepsin to dissolve proteins and ultimately promote easy and proper digestion of food.

Sounds good so far â€” what could possibly go wrong? Quite a lot, when you consider our fast-paced world and its endless array of quick and easy packaged foods, snacks and convenient meals on the run. Hypochlorhydria is triggered in a variety of ways, including consumption of fried or processed food, foods containing gluten or dairy products, and alcohol or caffeine-based drinks. People with auto-immune conditions or food sensitivities and intolerances can be particularly vulnerable. Contributing to this condition is the simple and unfortunate fact that as we age, the body's production of HCl tends to slow down, thus making easy digestion less predictable and harder to manage.

The symptoms of hypochlorhydria? They are diverse but certainly hard to miss. They include abdominal pain, heartburn, nausea, gas, bloating, constipation and even vomiting of sour liquid known as "water brash." Other common symptoms include loss of appetite, offensive breath, a sense of fullness and discomfort during or after meals, and difficulty digesting fruits and vegetables. Blood tests can also reveal symptoms such as elevated serum protein or globulin, or decreased phosphorus levels.

This condition should never be ignored or left untreated.

While it might seem easy to simply dismiss these common symptoms as the occasional cost of eating on the run or paying too little attention to your diet, this condition should never be ignored or left untreated.

Reaching for an easy Band-Aid solution is not the answer

Untreated â€” or treated with typical Band-Aid solutions such as antacid tablets and other over-the-counter remedies â€” this condition can lead to irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), yeast overgrowth, deficiencies involving important nutrients like B12, magnesium and calcium, as well as parasites or anxiety and depression. Hypochlorhydria can also lead to an auto-immune disease, which develops when your immune system begins to attack healthy cells that it mistakenly recognizes as unhealthy. There are as many as 80 types of auto-immune diseases, many displaying similar symptoms and making them extremely difficult to diagnose.

Traditional medicine typically deals with auto-immune conditions by suppressing the immune system with the help of an array of medical experts, including a GI specialist for the stomach, neurologists for balance problems or migraines, endocrinologists for blood sugar imbalances or adrenal issues, rheumatologists for joint pain, and so on. This may be for just one patient!

Today's integrative medicine professionals are taking a different approach. Integrative medicine â€” which should be considered complementary rather than alternative â€” looks at how these systems are related, seeking to find the roots of the issue and remove the causes for all chronic conditions. This means taking a more systemic approach that transcends simply trying to manage or control individual symptoms.

It also means recognizing that one organ can and will affect another and create numerous diverse and recurring symptoms. The integrative approach uses medical testing to identify the issue, and addresses this via dietary changes and custom nutrition plans, along with supplementation, medication and even brain-based therapy for neurological compromise.

While that pain in the gut might seem temporary and easy enough to self-medicate with a simple tablet, hypochlorhydria and its implications for worsening health should be treated with great care. Being proactive with efforts to identify and treat the root causes of a condition will in turn evade the potential threat of far more serious health issues.

Follow HuffPost Canada Blogs on Facebook

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Never Ignore That Nagging Pain In Your Gut

SUMMARY:
When my kids went off to school full time, I had to let our beloved nanny go, which was difficult because she was an integral part of our family.
Previously on HuffPost:After all, the kids are having a good time and being looked after, while you're able to go about your business.
You're debating hiring a second nanny for the baby that is dueBelieve me â€” you do not need to have one nanny per child in the household.
Unless you are royalty or BeyoncÃ©, your children can absolutely share a nanny.
This can easily be learnt when a child has to share a nanny with a sibling.
TEXT:
I had a nanny for several years and she was awesome. Having someone on payroll allowed me to work from home and start my career as a parenting expert. When my kids went off to school full time, I had to let our beloved nanny go, which was difficult because she was an integral part of our family.

But sometimes there is a blurry boundary between what nannies provide in a family and our roles and responsibilities as parents. Wonderfully loved and competent nannies are desirable, but it also means we are more likely to rely on them too much.

Previously on HuffPost:

After all, the kids are having a good time and being looked after, while you're able to go about your business. But without being aware, we can accidentally slide down a slippery slope until we are so dependent on our nannies that instead of providing much needed family help, we allow the presence of a nanny to deteriorate how healthy families should function.

So, to help you avoid this, here are six signs you have fallen into the nanny dependency rabbit hole:

You're secretly jealous of the nanny

You may find yourself experiencing unpleasant feelings of jealousy because the nanny seems to be emotionally closer to your children and their friends and teachers than you are. You may begin to feel like an outsider to your own family.

This feeling, while understandable, is not healthy, so if you do feel jealous, ask yourself what can be done to get rid of these feelings in a healthy manner. It may be that you're not spending as much time with the kids as you want to, and while this is perfectly normal and fine, it may mean that you should try to spend a bit more quality time with your little ones instead of relying on the nanny to be there all the time.

Your kids aren't learning to be independent and responsible

If your school-aged children still expect someone to clear their plate from the table, or hang up their coats after they dump them on the floor, it could be that they are still reliant on the care their nanny provides.

Rather than letting this happen (after all, it's not fair for the nanny nor for the kids), as parents we should be taking this time to educate them on managing their responsibilities on their own. We all want our kids to grow up to be self-sufficient and thoughtful.

You have to consult your nanny about everything

If you have to ask for a lot personal information about your children, like what they want for their birthday, if they like chocolate or vanilla cake, and who to invite to their party, you may be a bit too dependent on the nanny. These are questions a nanny should be asking you, not the other way around.

You're debating hiring a second nanny for the baby that is due

Believe me â€” you do not need to have one nanny per child in the household. Unless you are royalty or BeyoncÃ©, your children can absolutely share a nanny.

One of the most important lessons a child can learn is that when others are busy they need to be a team player and wait while other peoples' needs are being met. This can easily be learnt when a child has to share a nanny with a sibling.

It's time to re-think how much care our children really need and by whom.

You haven't done a chore with a child in tow for a long time

When exactly was the last time you were inconvenienced by the presence of your kids and didn't hand them off to the nanny? Let's face it, doing the grocery shopping is faster without a kid in tow. Yes, it's much easier to leave the kids behind and head out solo, however, we can't ditch the kids for efficiency reasons every single time you need to be out and about.

The reality is, you have kids and life doesn't run as smoothly as when you were childless â€” but that is what you signed up for.

The reality is, you have kids and life doesn't run as smoothly as when you were childless â€” but that is what you signed up for.

You haven't played with your child, had a meal with them, or been home for tuck-ins in a long time

If all your information about your kids has come from updates from the nanny instead of from actually making time to create a parent-child memory, this is a cause for concern and a sure sign of dependency.
TITLE: How To Tell If You're Too Dependent On Your Nanny

SUMMARY:
"I can never afford to buy cheap."
Of course, she was talking about why buying more expensive goods would last longer than cheap ones destined to break, saving her cash in the long run.
What we're seeing in some quarters is a new 'premium consumer' - who's not afraid to spend more money on an item if they know it's been ethically sourced and ethically produced.
We want to get people pay the premium price with a big smile on their face and be proud about it.
The material we use is not particularly cheap because of its origin; it's made from recycled materials, including salvaged ocean plastics and by-products of the manufacturing industry.
TEXT:
My grandmother, like so many others of her generation, used to have a saying when it came to her choices as a consumer, and it's stuck with me to this day.

"I can never afford to buy cheap."

Of course, she was talking about why buying more expensive goods would last longer than cheap ones destined to break, saving her cash in the long run.

But that phrase also has important repercussions when it comes to ethical or green practice for us all right now.

And if we want to protect our planet, we need to abide by them.

Bear this in mind: According to research by the United Nation's International Resource Panel, the global population, which is set to grow by 28%, is predicted to use 71% more resources per capita by 2050.

Without urgent steps to increase efficiency, the global use of metals, biomass, minerals - such as sand and other materials - will increase from 85 to 186 billion tonnes per year by 2050.

That increased level of production isn't good for emissions, and it won't be too clever when it comes to climate change, either.

So what can we do to help?

One thing is to move away from a culture of buying cheap without questioning where the product in your hand came from - or what it's doing to the environment as a whole.

And the good news is that things are slowly changing for the better.

More and more consumers understand the consequences of their consumption habits and therefore increasingly pay attention to the responsibility of their preferred companies and the brands they use in their purchasing decisions.

The raging debates about climate change, carbon offsetting, ocean pollution, human rights and child labour has made consumers more aware of the ecological, ethical and financial insecurity of our current consumption.

And it's vital we convince more to follow suit if we're going to move to a more sustainable future.

What we're seeing in some quarters is a new 'premium consumer' - who's not afraid to spend more money on an item if they know it's been ethically sourced and ethically produced.

We want to get people pay the premium price with a big smile on their face and be proud about it.

It's an ethos companies like my own have embraced.

For us, there's a reason our products - eco-friendly underpants - command a higher price than other undies on the shelves.

The material we use is not particularly cheap because of its origin; it's made from recycled materials, including salvaged ocean plastics and by-products of the manufacturing industry.

It's labour intensive.

Yet we also want to make a product that lasts, one that sticks two fingers up to modern 'throw-away-ism' habits.

And it's our hope that as more people start using this material in their own manufacturing, the price to the consumer will come down, making it even more appealing.

Let's say no to disposable culture and fast fashion and let's start thinking about the bigger picture.

Because if we don't, we'll all ultimately shoulder the cost.

https://theotherdanishguy.co.uk
TITLE: Why We Can't Afford To Buy Cheap

As a result of chronic under-rest, our wellbeing is eroding.
To bring awareness -- and solutions -- to this public health issue, The Huffington Post has partnered with Sleep NumberÂ® to present Sleep + Wellness, an editorial section dedicated to empowering readers to live their best, healthiest lives by gaining a better understanding of sleep as a crucial pillar of our well-being.

TEXT:
James Breakwell is perhaps best known in the parenting world by his Twitter handle, @XplodingUnicorn, where he tweets about his hilarious experiences as a dad.

According to Breakwell, the Exploding Unicorn name came from a line in a fake Biblical book he wrote in high school. He explained: â€œFor reasons that have been lost to time, I included a passage about unicorns filled with hydrogen. It ended with the line, â€˜...and thatâ€™s where we get the saying, â€œIt exploded like a unicorn.â€â€™ Clearly I had too much time on my hands, but the mental image stuck.â€

Through the Exploding Unicorn comedy brand, Breakwell has built up his audience with funny and honest accounts of parenting his four daughters. â€œWhen you read about my kids, youâ€™re not really reading about my kids. Youâ€™re reading about your own children,â€ says Breakwell. â€œAll kids are weird and quirky and unintentionally funny.â€

James Breakwell Parents need help during the zombie apocalypse, too.

For Breakwellâ€™s newest comedy project, heâ€™s written a helpful book titled Only Dead on the Inside: A Parentâ€™s Guide to Surviving the Zombie Apocalypse. The impetus behind the book was simple: â€œMost parenting guides are too serious, and most zombie survival guides donâ€™t tell you what to do if you have a family,â€ he explains. â€œOnly Dead on the Inside fills in that gap and combines two genres in a book no one asked for but everyone needs.â€ At the moment, Breakwell notes that no one whoâ€™s read the book has died in a zombie attack, so the book really offers a 100 percent survival rate.

And more good news: Breakwell also believes that being a parent is an inherent advantage during a zombie apocalypse. â€œThe apocalypse canâ€™t break us. As the title of the book suggests, weâ€™re already dead on the inside,â€ says Breakwell.

In honor of his new book out this month, weâ€™ve gathered some of @XplodingUnicorns funniest tweets about parenting. Enjoy, and check out his book if youâ€™re hoping to survive any future zombie apocalypses (or just looking for a good laugh).

Marriage is mostly just sending each other memes while your kids destroy the house around you. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) August 6, 2017

[sees teacher from school at the store]



7-year-old: They let you out? â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) September 30, 2017

My 4-year-old calls Dunkin' Donuts "Drunken Donuts."



I was going to correct her.



Then I realized it was the best idea ever for a bakery. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) June 9, 2016

I thought there was nothing worse than when my kids fought.



Then they started working together. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) March 10, 2016

5-year-old: My sisters are always around.



Me: They live here, too.



5: They don't have to. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) July 29, 2017

I forgot the diaper bag so Iâ€™m at the doctorâ€™s office with diapers hanging out of my pockets and I think the moms in the lobby are impressed â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) June 7, 2017

My 5-year-old called Parmesan cheese â€œspaghetti sprinklesâ€ and now that's officially a food group in my house. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) September 23, 2017

[two of my four kids burst into tears]



Random lady walking by: Why are you crying, girls?



Me: It's cute that you think there's a reason. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) May 25, 2016

Me: I thought you'd be dressed by now.



7-year-old: I thought you knew better. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) August 20, 2017

My 2-year-old called the vehicle for sick people a "wee woo truck" and now I don't even remember what the right name is anymore. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) May 17, 2017

Me: Did you have a good day at school?



6-year-old: That's not how school works. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) May 8, 2017

I never thought I'd have to tell my kids, "Don't use your little sister for bullfighting," yet here we are. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) September 3, 2017

The fastest person on earth isn't Usain Bolt.



It's any parent with a toddler who just said they have to poop. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) August 17, 2017

[only have 1 frozen pizza when we need 2]



5-year-old: It's enough for me.



Me: What about everybody else?



5: They can watch. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) July 27, 2017

How to take off shoes like my 4-year-old:



1) Remove shoe



2) Place it on shoe tray



3) Remove other shoe



4) Toss it into another dimension â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) February 2, 2017

My 3-year-old is pretending to read.



She's saying the words to "Going on a Bear Hunt."



But she's holding "The Berenstain Bears."



Awkward. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) September 13, 2017

Best vacation destinations according to my 4-year-old:



3) McDonald's play place



2) car wash



1) sidewalk where she saw a dog that one time â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) June 20, 2016

Wife: *back from the store* How were the kids?



Me: Great.



Wife: I took them with me. You didn't even notice



Me: I thought they were quiet â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) February 11, 2016

When I got my toddler out of bed, she gave me a big hug to show how much she loves me.



Just kidding.



She hit me with a shoe. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) July 10, 2017

Things the baby tried to eat instead of baby food:



1) an unroasted coffee bean



2) a small rock she found on the ground



3) her own foot â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) April 5, 2016

Me: Pay the bills.

Me: No. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) June 17, 2017

I'm not sure what my kids did in this room, but based on the debris pattern I'd say they ritually sacrificed a chocolate doughnut. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) April 3, 2017

Me: Shift?



4: Yeah. When you got mad driving.



Me: Just shifting gears.



I drive an automatic. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) September 16, 2016

Being a parent is pretty fulfilling if you like giving good advice that gets completely ignored 100 percent of the time. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) August 15, 2016

My 3-year-old shouted, â€œLook out! Iâ€™m backing up!â€



Iâ€™m raising a truck. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) September 3, 2017

4-year-old: Did you know you can put cheese on anything?



Me: What?



4: *intense whisper* ANYTHING. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) April 19, 2017

I can hear my 6-year-old singing "We Will Rock You" in the bathroom.



I'm not sure what's happening in there, but apparently it's going well â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) July 27, 2016

[bed time]



Me: Your mom told you to stay in bed.



3-year-old: There's a scary monster in my closet



Me: Scarier than Mom?



3: *goes to bed* â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) April 28, 2016

5-year-old: Can we buy that?



Me: It's too expensive



5: Use your credit card. Then it's free



Guess who's never getting her own credit card â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) January 15, 2016

2-year-old: *frantically points at the pig*



Me: What's wrong?



2: *intense whisper* SHE'S NAKED. â€” James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) June 1, 2017
TITLE: 31 Hilarious Tweets From A Dad Whoâ€™s Ready For Anything

SUMMARY:
Last week, Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn announced his latest plans to implement a "Robot Tax" in a bold effort to face the "challenge" of automation.
This proposed tax is part of his larger plan to "urgently manage" the evolution of robotics and technology for the sake of society.
The Question of EmploymentThere is no denying that with the introduction of robots comes a slight shift in the overall employment landscape.
Britain's unemployment rate is currently at a 42-year low, showing that regardless of the increase in automation, jobs seem to be largely unaffected.
Measures such as a "Robot Tax" are nothing more than a step backwards when it comes to productivity and the overall well-being of society.
TEXT:
Last week, Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn announced his latest plans to implement a "Robot Tax" in a bold effort to face the "challenge" of automation. This proposed tax is part of his larger plan to "urgently manage" the evolution of robotics and technology for the sake of society. And, while this may seem like a daring statement, it's not exactly the first time it's been proposed. A handful of other leaders around the globe, including Bill Gates and the South Korean government, have quite recently raised similar points. But when broken down, is this hostility towards the evolution of technology really warranted?

Modern Fear

It's no secret that the media has had a huge part to play in the current state of automation. Since the first mention of robots hit the 24-hour news cycle, hundreds of articles have warned of a robotic takeover and an impending meltdown of society. What's usually left out of these articles, however, is the thorough research highlighting the benefits robotics and automation have on society. For example, it has been found that use of robots within manufacturing has increased labour productivity by 0.36%. While that may sound insignificant, it's key to point out that 0.36% accounts for 16% of total productivity growth between 1992 and 2007. And while robotisation has traditionally been adopted by financial and manufacturing sectors, its contribution is not limited to these particular verticals. For example, a report by London's Centre for Economic Research shows that contrary to popular belief, robots have been a huge driver of productivity and economic growth within most markets. This is due to the fact that robots have been able to successful integrate within a number of professions, eliminating the costs, risks and wasted time associated with manual tasks. Yet robots still seem to be the victim of fear mongering rhetoric within the media, mainly due to one particular topic--the dissolution of jobs.

The Question of Employment

There is no denying that with the introduction of robots comes a slight shift in the overall employment landscape. With that said, it's unfair to suggest that automation will be the be all and end all of the job market. As a society, we've been through this before. When the Industrial Revolution occurred, the entire job market went into a frenzy, leaving about half of workers wondering what to do next. But with time came great change. The job market rapidly began to evolve in conjunction with technology, resulting in the creation of jobs that had never even existed before.

While it's difficult to predict the exact outcome, it seems as if history is due to repeat itself. Britain's unemployment rate is currently at a 42-year low, showing that regardless of the increase in automation, jobs seem to be largely unaffected. Luckily, this seems to be a direct representation of the future. According to a recent report by PWC, it's predicted that AI and robotics will both create new jobs, specifically in the digital technology area. These new jobs will generate additional wealth and spending that will then support additional jobs of existing kinds, primarily in sectors that are historically harder to automate.

Arguing Against Robot Tax

In comparison to other leading nations, the U.K unfortunately still slightly lags behind when it comes to robotisation and AI. And while this may be due to our modern fear of the robotic revolution, it's ultimately a dangerous game to play. In order to stay competitive within the global economy, it's extremely important to put an emphasis on the future of technology and innovation. Instead of shying away from what we're uncomfortable with, we should be focusing on where to go next.

Continuous innovation is an essential part of a robust economy. Yes, without a doubt, technology will shift our lives as we know it today. But, why should we approach this change with fear? Measures such as a "Robot Tax" are nothing more than a step backwards when it comes to productivity and the overall well-being of society. As a forward thinking society, we have a huge amount of opportunity to utilise this innovative technology to create positive change, not only when it comes to supporting the economy, but to create new channels for society that we may not reach otherwise.
TITLE: Rethinking The Robot Tax

Er mag viel darÃ¼ber reden, dass der Klimawandel ein Mythos ist oder PlÃ¤ne fÃ¼r eine Wiederbelebung der fossilen Energie schmieden â€“ aber gleichzeitig kÃ¼mmert sich sein Land darum, in eine Zukunft mit sauberer Energie zu starten.
Aber: Das Land ist fÃ¼r seinen Willen, die weltweite Nummer eins zu werden, bekannt.
TEXT:
Die USA sind in Sachen Energie vorbildlicher, als viele vermuten.

Erneuerbare Stromquellen? Einhalt dem Klimawandel? Themen, von denen US-PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump nichts hÃ¤lt. Im Gegenteil: Es scheint, als sei das Land kurz davor, sich in eine stinkende, ruÃŸige HÃ¶lle zu verwandeln. SchlieÃŸlich hat Trump im Juni das Pariser Klimaabkommen aufgekÃ¼ndigt und FÃ¶rderungen fÃ¼r fossile Energiequellen wie die Kohle versprochen.

Das aber bedeutet nicht, dass die USA in Sachen grÃ¼ne Energie rÃ¼ckstÃ¤ndig wÃ¤ren. TatsÃ¤chlich bahnt das Land den Weg fÃ¼r erneuerbare Energien â€“ an den Vorstellungen des PrÃ¤sidenten vorbei.

Der Ruf des Geldes

Wie das geht? Die Antwort ist das Zitat eines frÃ¼heren amerikanischen PrÃ¤sidenten: â€Itâ€™s the economy, stupidâ€œ, also: â€Es geht um die Wirtschaft, Dummkopfâ€œ. Erneuerbare Energien sind ein MilliardengeschÃ¤ft. Die Solarindustrie etwa schafft ArbeitsplÃ¤tze 17-mal schneller als der Rest der Wirtschaft. Mittlerweile beschÃ¤ftigt sie in den USA 370.000 Menschen â€“ mehr als doppelt so viele wie der Kohlesektor. Schneller wachsen die Photovoltaik-Industrien nur in China und Japan. Durch den rasanten Zuwachs sind auch fÃ¼r amerikanische Firmen die Einkaufspreise gefallen â€“ um mehr als die HÃ¤lfte seit 2008.

Zugleich wird Windkraft in den USA zu einer der gÃ¼nstigsten Energieformen, die es gibt. Derzeit wird im Schnitt alle 2,4 Stunden ein neues Windrad in Betrieb genommen. In den kommenden Jahren soll Wind die Wasserkraft als grÃ¶ÃŸte erneuerbare Energiequelle ablÃ¶sen.

Im Bundesstaat Iowa stammen 35% der Energie aus Windkraft, vorn mit dabei sind auch Kansas, North und South Dakota. Ãœberraschend daran: Diese Staaten sind in der Hand der Republikaner â€“ die fÃ¼r grÃ¼ne Politik notorisch wenig Ã¼brighaben. AuÃŸer dadurch lassen sich Geld und Jobs machen. Da in den USA noch mehr als 181 Millionen Hektar darauf warten, mit WindrÃ¤dern bebaut zu werden, kann der GeschÃ¤ftszweig noch lange Zeit weiterwachsen.

Erneuerbare Meilensteine

Der Boom bei Solar- und Windkraft bewegt etwas. Die Studie einer US-UmweltbehÃ¶rde hat in diesem Jahr belegt, dass Strom aus nachhaltigen Quellen erstmals die Marke von zehn Prozent beim Anteil der US-Energieproduktion Ã¼berschritten hat. Klar, im Vergleich zu Europa ist das verschwindend wenig. Vorreiter auf dem alten Kontinent sind Schweden, Norwegen, DÃ¤nemark â€“ und wir in Deutschland. An einem Tag im April dieses Jahres stieg hierzulande der Anteil der erneuerbaren Energien auf satte 85 Prozent â€“ erzeugt aus Wind, Sonne, Biomasse und Wasser.

Ein US-Staat ist den europÃ¤ischen VerhÃ¤ltnissen aber stark auf den Fersen: Kalifornien. Im Mai dieses Jahres waren 80 Prozent des erzeugten Stroms aus erneuerbaren Quellen. Wind- und Solarkraft gibt es hier reichlich. Hinzu kommen die Tech-Konzerne, die sich fÃ¼r Innovationen engagieren. Kalifornien ist die Blaupause fÃ¼r grÃ¼ne Energie in den USA. Die ganze Nation soll einer Studie zufolge im Jahr 2050 soweit sein.

Zudem erÃ¶ffnen sich weitere Marktnischen: Aus den erneuerbaren Quellen fallen erhebliche Strommengen an. Die muss das Netz auch verkraften kÃ¶nnen â€“ eine Stromleitung muss man sich nÃ¤mlich wie eine Autobahn vorstellen, auf der es zu Spitzenzeiten eng wird. Darum muss der Strom gespeichert werden. In diesem Feld wollen sich viele Firmen etablieren.

In Kalifornien stimmen auch die politischen Rahmenbedingungen. Viele BÃ¼rgermeister sind begeistert und gehen voran â€“ etwa mit Projekten wie dem Ã–PNV-System BART in San Francisco, das bis 2045 komplett mit sauberer Energie betrieben werden soll. Und in Los Angeles soll bis 2020 ein Drittel sÃ¤mtlicher Energie grÃ¼n sein.

Manche StÃ¤dte wollen noch weiter gehen. Im Juni einigten sich mehr als 250 BÃ¼rgermeister auf einer Konferenz in Miami Beach darauf, ihre StÃ¤dte bis 2035 vollstÃ¤ndig aus erneuerbaren Energien zu speisen.

Ein ambitioniertes Ziel. Wichtig ist, dass der Wille da ist. Beispiel Las Vegas: Die GlÃ¼cksspielstadt ist notorisch fÃ¼r Exzesse. Aber Laternen, Parks, Feuerwachen, Gemeindezentren und RegierungsgebÃ¤ude werden vollstÃ¤ndig mit grÃ¼nem Strom betrieben. Das deutlich grÃ¶ÃŸere Chicago will bis 2025 an dem Punkt sein. New York will bis 2030 die HÃ¤lfte seines Bedarfs aus sauberer Quelle decken.

Zukunftssicher

Klar ist: Donald Trump hat die Energieindustrie seines Landes nicht verstanden. Er mag viel darÃ¼ber reden, dass der Klimawandel ein Mythos ist oder PlÃ¤ne fÃ¼r eine Wiederbelebung der fossilen Energie schmieden â€“ aber gleichzeitig kÃ¼mmert sich sein Land darum, in eine Zukunft mit sauberer Energie zu starten.

Im Vergleich mit Europa sind die Vereinigten Staaten noch im Hintertreffen. Aber: Das Land ist fÃ¼r seinen Willen, die weltweite Nummer eins zu werden, bekannt. In einigen Jahrzehnten kÃ¶nnte es soweit sein. Es ist eine ganz andere Interpretation der Populisten-Parole â€America Firstâ€œ â€“ auf eine Weise, bei der jeder gewinnt.
TITLE: Dieses Land ist Weltmeister der grÃ¼nen Energie

SUMMARY:
The most recent shocking salt discovery are ready meals found on the supermarket shelves, fridges and freezers, such as mac and cheese, noodle dishes and curries.
The average ready meal from the supermarket freezer, fridge and shelf contains 50 percent of an adult's recommended daily salt intake.
"The results of our survey show the amount of ready meals in the store had more than doubled in the last seven years, and that ready meals are packed with salt," Farrand said.
Even more staggering is some of the ready meals we surveyed contained an entire day's worth of salt in a single meal.
Cook your own fresh meals where possible and use herbs and spices for flavour.
TEXT:
We know foods like chips, pretzels and deli meats contain high levels of salt, but many people would be surprised to know sodium is lurking in unsuspecting items like bread, pasta sauce and salad dressing.

The most recent shocking salt discovery are ready meals found on the supermarket shelves, fridges and freezers, such as mac and cheese, noodle dishes and curries.

As part of the Unpack The Salt Campaign led by the Heart Foundation and VicHealth, The George Institute analysed nearly 1,500 ready meals from Woolworths, Coles, ALDI and IGA, and found some contained almost a whole day's worth of salt in just one serve. The average ready meal from the supermarket freezer, fridge and shelf contains 50 percent of an adult's recommended daily salt intake.

Seeing as convenience/ready meals are a booming industry (currently worth $900 million), this is a huge health worry.

To find out the supermarket meals containing the highest (and lowest) amount of salt, HuffPost Australia spoke to Clare Farrand, The George Institute's public health nutritionist and senior project manager for Salt Reduction.

Salt is found in a vast amount of foods and can add up quickly across the day.

Why is too much salt dangerous?

"At the moment we're all eating too much salt around the world," Farrand told HuffPost Australia. "There's a global target that we shouldn't eat any more than five grams of salt per day. In Australia we're eating about double this.

"Salt increases our blood pressure and this puts us at increased risk of stroke, heart attack and heart disease. These are called cardiovascular diseases which are the biggest killer worldwide."

The reason salt is a particular concern is there are no symptoms for high blood pressure, so you don't know you have the condition unless you get your blood pressure checked regularly.

Why is salt added to food?

Although salt is an effective preservative, the main reason food manufacturers add salt is to make food more tasty.

"This amount of salt isn't needed for preservative and texture. The amount of salt put in these meals is designed to improve or mask the taste," Farrand said.

"We have a drive to want to eat salt, and the more salt we eat the more we crave. Food manufacturers add lots of salt to food because it increases our drive to eat more of these foods. It hits those pleasure centres in our brain, much like sugar does."

What are the saltiest (and least salty) supermarket meals?

In the study the researchers looked at the highest and lowest salt content within the three ready meal categories: frozen, chilled and shelf.

"The results of our survey show the amount of ready meals in the store had more than doubled in the last seven years, and that ready meals are packed with salt," Farrand said.

"The average ready meal contains about half of our daily recommended maximum salt intake, and that's just in one meal -- we usually have three meals a day so this would certainly push us over our daily recommended limit. Even more staggering is some of the ready meals we surveyed contained an entire day's worth of salt in a single meal.

"These meals don't necessarily taste salty so many people aren't aware of how much salt the product really contains."

5 highest salt shelf ready meals (based on salt per 100g) Kraft Deluxe Mac and Cheese -- 783mg/100g sodium -- 1.96g/100g salt -- 4.42g salt per serve Harvest Braised Steak and Onion -- 638mg/100g sodium -- 1.60g/100g salt -- 3.39g salt per serve Wokka Shelf Fresh Noodles with Mi Goreng Sauce -- 630mg/100g sodium -- 1.58g/100g salt -- 5.51g salt per serve Maharajah's Choice Dhal Makhani -- sodium 590mg/100g -- 1.48g/100g salt -- 2.09g salt per serve Podravka Beef Goulash -- 535mg/100g sodium -- 1.34g/100g salt -- 2.01g salt per serve

5 lowest salt shelf ready meals (based on salt per 100g) Sun Rice Street Snack Chicken Satay -- 170mg/100g sodium -- 0.43g/100g salt -- 0.85g salt per serve Aldi Asia Specialities Hokkein Noodles with Peanut Satay Sauce -- 179mg/100g sodium -- 0.45g/100g salt -- 1.48 per serve SunRice Thai Style Chicken Satay Curry with Rice -- 193mg/100g sodium -- 0.48g/100g salt -- 1.69g salt per serve John West Tuna and Rice Chilli and Tomato -- 194mg/100g sodium -- 0.49g/100g salt -- 0.97g salt per serve John West Tuna Brown Rice and Quinoa Thai Red Curry -- 195mg/100g sodium -- 0.49g/100g salt -- 0.98g salt per serve

5 highest salt chilled ready meals (based on salt per 100g) Brubecks Boutique Foods Kato Organic Soba Noodle Salad with Teriyaki Dressing -- 828mg/100g sodium -- 2.07g/100g salt -- 4.14g salt per serve Quick as Wok Chicken Teriyaki -- 780mg/100g sodium -- 1.95g/100g salt -- 5.85g salt per serve Brubecks Boutique Foods Chinese Style Egg Noodle Salad with Fresh Vegetables and Sesame Soy -- 724mg/100g sodium -- 1.81g/100g salt -- 3.62g salt per serve Quick as Wok Beef Rendang -- 657mg/100g sodium -- 1.64g/100g salt -- 4.93g salt per serve Spice and Passion Thai Green Chicken Curry -- 540mg/100g sodium -- 1.35g/100g salt -- 4.73g salt per serve

5 lowest salt chilled ready meals (based on salt per 100g) My Pasta Box Classic Tomato and Basil Penne -- 37mg/100g sodium -- 0.09g/100g salt -- 0.26g salt per serve Fresh Fodder Milk Chicken and Rice Curry -- 65mg/100g sodium -- 0.16g/100g salt -- 0.49g salt per serve Woolworths Delicious Nutritious Michelle Bridges Beef and Barley Casserole with Roasted Vegetables -- 102mg/100g sodium -- 0.26g/100g salt -- 0.89g salt per serve My Pasta Box Rich Bolognese Rigatoni -- 104mg/100g sodium -- 0.26g/100g salt -- 0.73g salt per serve Fresh Fodder Beef and Pasta Bolognese with Red Wine -- 133mg/100g sodium -- 0.33g/100g salt -- 1g salt per serve

5 highest salt frozen ready meals (based on salt per 100g) CP Authentic Asia Prawn Wonton Tom Yum Ramen Soup -- 595mg/100g sodium -- 1.49g/100g salt -- 4.79g salt per serve Super Nature Middle Easter Chciek with Quinoa Tabbouleh -- 504mg/100g sodium -- 1.26g/100g salt -- 4.41g salt per salt On the Menu All Day Breakfast -- 491mg/100g sodium -- 1.23g/100g salt -- 3.93g salt per serve Super Nature Chicken Pad Thai with Rice Noodles -- 490mg/100g sodium -- 1.23g/100g salt -- 4.29g salt per serve On the Menu Beef Schnitzel -- 405mg/100g sodium -- 1.01g/100g salt -- 3.24g salt per serve

5 lowest salt frozen ready meals (based on salt per 100g) The Sultan's Kitchen Butter Chicken -- 84mg/100g sodium -- 0.21g/100g salt -- 0.53g salt per serve McCain Healthy Choice Lemon Chicken with Asian Veg and Rice-- 90mg/100g sodium -- 0.23g/100g salt -- 0.79g salt per serve The Good Meal Co. Gluten Free Risotto Primavera -- 94mg/100g sodium -- 0.24g/100g salt -- 0.88g salt per serve Super Nature Beef, Kale and Red Quinoa Lasagne -- 129mg/100g sodium -- 0.32g/100g salt -- 1.13g salt per serve International Cuisine Beef in Red Wine Sauce with Mash -- 130mg/100g sodium -- 0.33g/100g salt -- 0.98g salt per serve

It's important to note this study analysed the salt content, not the overall nutrition, in ready meals.

Cook your own fresh meals where possible and use herbs and spices for flavour.

Tips for reducing salt intake

1. Read the labels. Choose lower salt options by comparing the sodium content in the 'per 100g' column on the nutrition information panel. Low salt/sodium is considered to be less than 130mg per 100 grams. Up to 400mg is an 'okay' option;

2. Eat more fresh foods and reduce intake of processed and packaged foods;

3. Use herbs and spices for flavour instead of relying on salt when cooking at home;

4. Use the FoodSwitch app when food shopping to scan and find food products with lower sodium content.
TITLE: These Supermarket Meals Contain A Whole Day's Worth Of Salt

TEXT:

As parents we cannot take all responsibility all the time for the meaning our children create from everything they experience, but we can support them to feel loved and to create more feelings of love in their life. Transformational Guide, Coach, Social Entrepreneur, Writer, Speaker.

Starting School: Different Families So, do those of us with 'different families' feel any additional anxiety surrounding their children starting school? Should we take be taking further steps in settling our children (and us) into the school community? Mother of Two | Director of Family Facilitation | TechPixie

The Family We Built In a big family house by the sea, I watch my four-year-old blonde daughter launch herself across the couch to gleefully 'body slam' her doppleganger blonde father. One and the same Mr Happy our sperm donor, Scott is now my husband and Leila's dad. Author of How I Met Your Father - the true story of a woman who overcame tragic losses to find love and happiness in a most unexpected way.

How Home-Schooling Can Help Families To Thrive! Over eight years ago, my family started a new journey: Home Education. It was a journey ahead that felt extremely frightening, as I knew I would be wholly responsibility for my children's learning, and super exciting as I knew that there would be many adventures ahead! Lisa is a blogger, she writes at www.AnOrdinary-Life.blogspot.co.uk Lisa writes about Homeschooling and Step by Step educational resources!

How Can You Tell If Your Parenting Is Good Enough? We get so carried away with making everything perfect all the time. Trying to reach that elusive parenting dream, thrust upon us by advertising. We forget that it's not the big gestures. It's that cuddle, that story, that time spent together. Think back to your childhood memories. Was the first thing you thought about a material thing or was it time you spent with your parents? Super Mum, Super Nurse, & Super Tired!

A Letter To My Little Boy, Whatever The Weather There was a moment when I knew, beyond any doubt, what it meant to be your mother. But it wasn't the day you were born. It wasn't the first time I knew about you, even - a long-awaited pink line forming in front of my eyes as I sat, perched on the edge of the cold bath, waiting. Editor, writer, blogger, wife and mother

Living Beyond The Norm. What It's Like Being The Family To A Big Wave Surfer His drive and focus is what keeps him going and we know that whenever he goes away, whether it is for a few days or a few weeks, he'll always be back to make up for lost time. In reality, we're just like any other family where one parent has to have time away with work. It's just that ours involves a little bit more risk and adventure. Globe-trotter | Mother of two | Married to a big wave surfer

Me, The Boys And The Game Of Cricket At the moment, I am the Dad who watches from the sideline. From the point of view of a thriving family, we have found a sport that both our sons seem to want to play, One of the great things about cricket is the way that it can make a family feel part of a community and a community spirit. Lecturer. Sport. Medical matters. Sport and medical matters.

Why I've Stopped Reading Parenting Articles I've found recently the amount of articles explaining what NOT to do is becoming overwhelming and actually hindering me to the point of utter indecision. We are bombarded daily by articles telling us how to parent Stay at home Mum and writer

To The Partner Of The Parent At Home So, my point here is that as the partner of a parent at home, you, whether you realise it or not, provide much of that validation. Next to our children, you are the most important people in our lives. You are the other half of this parenting team and your opinion means a LOT Stay at home Mum and writer

I Am An Older Mum. Get Over It (Everyone)! When I look back on this wobbly route to motherhood I am heartened to learn that far from damaging my child by being older I am potentially giving him a better life by virtue of me being wealthier, more stable and experienced. Clinical Psychologist, part time writer, people person and mother. Passionate about sharing psychological science with human beings.

What Makes A Strong-Mum? So what is a 'Strong Mum'? We throw these words around as if it's a description, when in actual fact there doesn't seem to be a way to define the term. I think it's clear that being strong isn't just about lifting weights and eating healthy, there are times when in order to be strong you have to make a tough decision, or be brave when you're scared or juggle multiple activities. Health & Fitness Expert, Pre & Postnatal Exercise Specialist & Wellness Commentator

Families Must Adapt To Thrive The dynamics of families can change, the dynamics will switch and I'm very lucky that within the Harper clan this has always been how we've worked. A family can only work if it adjusts itself to suit each person in it. Theatre Director, Tutor, Writer, Son, Brother, Partner and Friend.
TITLE: thriving-parents

Con mensajes como: "Nunca pierdan la esperanza", "No dejes que la adversidad te derrote", "No te rindas nunca", "Lucha", etc., ciudadanos japoneses envÃ­an apoyo a los mexicanos que resultaron afectados por los temblores de septiembre pasado.

TEXT:
En abril del aÃ±o pasado, un temblor de magnitud 7.3 azotÃ³ el sur de JapÃ³n, un dÃ­a despuÃ©s de que otro sismo magnitud 6,5 sacudiera la isla de Kyushu.

El aÃ±o anterior (febrero de 2015), un terremoto con epicentro al noreste de la principal isla del paÃ­s, Honshu, reportÃ³ un sismo de 6,9. En esa ocasiÃ³n, los rascacielos de Tokio y sus alrededores se tambalearon, segÃºn informÃ³ la agencia AFP en un reporte levantado por la BBC.

En 2014 se reportaron 14 sismos, la mayorÃ­a de una magnitud entre 5 y 6. El mÃ¡s intenso ocurriÃ³ el 3 de marzo, fue de 6,9 y se registrÃ³ a 110 km de Nago.

Sin embargo, el Gran terremoto de JapÃ³n ocurriÃ³ el 11 de marzo de 2011. Tuvo una magnitud de 8,9, con epicentro a unos 400 kilÃ³metros de Tokio y a unos 32 kilÃ³metros de profundidad. Posteriormente provocÃ³ un tsunami.

Con lo anterior, lo que tratamos de decir es que si un paÃ­s sabe de terremotos ese es JapÃ³n.

Por eso es totalmente emotivo que un par de ciudadanos salieran a las calles de JapÃ³n para solicitar donativos que enviarÃ­an a los damnificados del temblor, a travÃ©s de la Cruz Roja.

El video viral, publicado en la pÃ¡gina de Facebook JapÃ³nAndMore, muestra una serie de entrevistas realizadas por los donantes, asÃ­ como extractos de declaraciones de los rescatistas japoneses.

Con mensajes como: "Nunca pierdan la esperanza", "No dejes que la adversidad te derrote", "No te rindas nunca", "Lucha", etc., ciudadanos japoneses envÃ­an apoyo a los mexicanos que resultaron afectados por los temblores de septiembre pasado.

La colecta, que se realizÃ³ entre Nagoya y Toyota, recaudÃ³ aproximadamente 6,500 mil pesos.

Puedes ver el video a continuaciÃ³n.

SUMMARY:
It's the bomb you drop on the first date if you want to send any dating prospect off to NOPEville.
Money is one of the top cited reasons for conflict in a relationship and often attributed to couples breaking up.
You've thought about it, you've done your research, you've made a short-list of contenders, and you've finally (after much deliberation) decided on 'the one'.
Head of Communications, MysteryVibeFour Last Minute Winter Wedding Planning Tips Winter is a magical season for a wedding.
I don't know what the future holds for Tanya and I, but if nothing else, I've make a new friend.
TEXT:
Why It's Totally Okay To Be Clingy In Relationships 'Clingy' has long been deemed as one of the most undesirable traits that could instantly turn off any level of interest. It's the bomb you drop on the first date if you want to send any dating prospect off to NOPEville. In a nutshell, no one, I repeat, no one wants to be seen as clingy. Blogger and story teller

What Do Most Couples Misunderstand About Money? Although money is just a tool, it is a tool that holds a lot of power. Money is one of the top cited reasons for conflict in a relationship and often attributed to couples breaking up. Getting a better grasp on what money means and how it operates between partners is paramount. In that light, here are four often misunderstood financial considerations for couples to keep in mind: A place to share knowledge and better understand the world

Love Is All Around Us (Even In My Chemo Unit) Richard Curtis once wrote that, 'love is everywhere', and none more so than at the arrivals gate at Heathrow Airport. I disagree. You'll find more love in my local chemo unit, but it's a different sort of love. It's deeper somehow. More evolved. Tinged with sadness but always driven by an overriding sense of hope. Freelance writer & blogger at www.kidsversuscopy.com

How To Introduce Sex Toys Into Your Relationship Buying your first sex toy is often a right of passage for a lot of women. You've thought about it, you've done your research, you've made a short-list of contenders, and you've finally (after much deliberation) decided on 'the one'. Head of Communications, MysteryVibe

Four Last Minute Winter Wedding Planning Tips Winter is a magical season for a wedding. The cold outdoors provides a fantastic contrast and backdrop for a warm and welcoming wedding. In the UK winter is the season of love and giving - everyone is in a good mood, looking ahead already to the New Year and the fresh start that comes with spring. Founder of Freak Music, one of the UK's leading entertainment agencies.

Why Is Gaslighting So Disturbing? Being gaslighted over time effectively disconnects you from yourself, your feelings, your ability to know what you want and don't want, what you know to be true about yourself, others, and the world. It can eventually strip a person of their core sense of themselves, leaving them feeling dependent upon the gaslighter to define reality and provide approval and confirmation of what is real. A place to share knowledge and better understand the world

Going On The Undateables Taught Me I Don't Need To Be Terrified Of Dating If I can take anything away from being on the show I would say it has given me the confidence to go out and enjoy dating. Rather than being terrified of it. I don't know what the future holds for Tanya and I, but if nothing else, I've make a new friend. Engineer and The Undateables star, living with brittle bones

Six Things You Should Know About Dating A Widowed Person About a year after my wife was killed, I was asked by some newspaper or other to write about my experience of dating as a widower. Having not written a word of fiction or fantasy since leaving high school, I politely declined the offer and rolled my eyes at the assumption that I would be back in the game so soon. Author of Sunday Times Bestseller 'It's Not Raining, Daddy, It's Happy' and writer of the award-winning blog 'Life as a Widower'

We Need More Transparency To Inform Young People That Porn Is An Industry And A Fantasy I recently had a 14 year old girl confide in me after a lesson - she explained she had hair growing around her genitals and wanted to know what was wrong with her. She'd never seen a vulva that wasn't completely bald, and genuinely believed her body hair was unnatural and abnormal. Brook Education and Wellbeing Specialist

Why Ghosting Someone Is The Worst Thing Ever We've all been there, you think the date you had last Tuesday went great, you've been texting non-stop and have agreed to meet again. Then all of a sudden, that person is gone. Drifted into the wind like a Greggs plastic bag.

What To Do If You Need To Poo On A First Date First dates can be a nerve-racking experience. You know you must do everything you can to make a great first impression. Every word, comment or action will be scrutinized and you are extremely careful to present the best version of yourself. So, it can be hugely embarrassing if nature calls and you find yourself having to run to the loo quickly. Dating Expert and Dating Coach

Partner Power: Supportive Relationships Linked To Personal Development In this study, 163 married couples who had been married on average 9.68 years and romantically involved for an average of 12 years, were divided into two roles where one was given a decision making role and the other, unbeknown to either of them, was observed for their role in supporting their spouse during the decision-making process. Relationships Coach & Psychologist & Relationship Expert for TV & Big Brands. Book 1 of 3 with Orion Publishing out Nov 2nd! Pre-Order Now (paperback/Kindle): http://bit.ly/ResilientMe

Telling Yourself That 'All The Good Ones Are Taken'? Call Bulls**t Yet another wasted date with a loser, a guy who didn't look anything like their photo, or worse - someone who seemed perfect on paper but in reality, another evening with them makes you feel like chewing your own arm off? Certified love & self-worth coach

Six Things You Need To Know (And Practise) To Have A Healthy Relationship Don't fall into a trap of believing that your self-worth is measured in your relationship status, don't ever believe that another person will be the one to make you happy. Learn to be happy and secure in yourself and look forward to sharing those positive things with a partner. A place to share knowledge and better understand the world

Not Another Barn Wedding: The Wedding Venue Alternatives Now don't get me wrong, I am a huge fan of a barn wedding - they're a great blank canvas, can be exclusively yours for the day, have beautiful grounds and are steeped in history. But the problem is, the rest of the country are pretty big fans too. Founder of WeddingPlanner.co.uk
TITLE: Dating & Relationships: Dates, Sex, Marriage & Divorce Advice & Tips

TEXT:
Carl Campeau, Kanadier und UN-Mitarbeiter, wurde vor vier Jahren von Islamisten in Syrien entfÃ¼hrt

Einer seiner Peiniger wurde nun in Deutschland verurteilt

Und Campeau erzÃ¤hlt eindringlich, wie er in Gefangenschaft fÃ¼r sein Leben kÃ¤mpfte

Im Video-Interview mit der HuffPost erklÃ¤rt er, warum aber nicht alles getan hÃ¤tte, um seine Haut zu retten

Sie hatten ihn gefangen. Eingesperrt. GequÃ¤lt. Aber seine Seele, die sollten sie nie bekommen. Das hatte sich Carl Campeau geschworen.

Es war der 17. Februar 2013 als der UN-Jurist aus Kanada das Camp sÃ¼dwestlich von Damaskus verlieÃŸ, von dem aus die Vereinten Nationen die GolanhÃ¶hen Ã¼berwachen. Er wollte zu einem Termin in die syrische Hauptstadt. Dinge klÃ¤ren, die man nicht am Telefon bespricht oder mailt. Und zu einem Physiotherapeuten, der sich um sein frisch operiertes Knie kÃ¼mmern sollte.

Leben und sterben lagen da schon sehr nahe beieinander in Syrien. Das Camp war zwar noch nicht von Al-Qaida-nahen Rebellen Ã¼berrannt. Aber in der Region kÃ¤mpfte das Assad-Regime gegen die Rebellen. Und die Rebellen gegen wieder andere Rebellen.

Campeaus Frau, selbst Syrerin, hatte ihn angefleht, die Fahrt nach Damaskus nicht anzutreten. Aber Campeau arbeitet seit vielen Jahren in Krisengebieten. AngehÃ¶rige zu beruhigen, das gehÃ¶rt zum Job, findet er. Ein gepanzerter Wagen war keiner frei, also nahm Campeau ein normales Auto, Helm und schusssichere Weste, und fuhr los.

Campeau in der Ã¼blichen Schutzmontur vor einem Wagen der UN. Foto: Herder

In einem Vorort der syrischen Hauptstadt, Khan al-Shih, stoppten ihn zwei MÃ¤nner, KÃ¤mpfer der islamistischen Al-Nusra-Front, die Gewehre im Anschlag. Sie zerrten ihn ums Auto, zwangen in auf den RÃ¼cksitz, karrten ihn zu einer Villa, die sie besetzt hatten. Campeaus dachte, sie wÃ¼rden ihn jetzt umbringen. (Wie er die EntfÃ¼hrung erlebt hat, kÃ¶nnt ihr hier in einem Buchauszug lesen.)

Einer der Dschihadisten wurde nun in Deutschland verurteilt

Heute ist Campeau 53 und versucht, das Erlebte zu verarbeiten. Den Zwang, zum Islam zu konvertieren. Acht Monate Angst bis zu seiner Flucht. Die Erfahrung, dass weder der Arbeitgeber noch der Heimatstaat LÃ¶segeld zahlen wollten, dass sie auch sonst kaum halfen. Das Wissen, dass die Gefahr fÃ¼r ihn heute kleiner geworden ist â€“ aber nicht vorbei.

Einer der vielen Dschihadisten, mit denen Campeau wÃ¤hrend seiner Geiselhaft zu tun hatte, kam als FlÃ¼chtling nach Deutschland. Vor drei Wochen hat das Oberlandesgericht Suliman al S. verurteilt, zu drei Jahren und sechs Monaten GefÃ¤ngnis. Die Bundesanwaltschaft hatte sieben Jahre gefordert. Nach ihren Angaben war es das erste Mal, dass in Deutschland ein FlÃ¼chtling wegen Kriegsverbrechen vor Gericht stand.

Suliman al-S. sitzt schon seit Anfang 2016 in Untersuchungshaft, bei guter FÃ¼hrung kÃ¶nnte er bald wieder frei kommen. AuÃŸer, die Bundesanwaltschaft, die in Revision gehen will, hat Erfolg.

Die Angst vor Rache

Wer Campeau, markante Brille, schwarzer Rollkragenpulli, an diesem windigen Herbsttag in MÃ¼nchen trifft, der lernt einen Menschen kennen, der sich wegen des Prozesses sorgt.

Nicht weil er das Urteil fÃ¼r zu milde hÃ¤lt. Sondern weil er fÃ¼rchtet, dass Suliman al-S. sich weiter radikalisieren und rÃ¤chen wird, wenn er noch lÃ¤nger eingesperrt bleibt. "An mir, meiner Familie oder der deutschen Gesellschaft."

Nach Syrien abschieben, sagt der Jurist, wird Deutschland Suliman al-S. nicht kÃ¶nnen. Das kÃ¶nnte dessen Tod bedeuten. Und das wÃ¼rde er auch nicht wollen, sagt Campeau.

Er weiÃŸ, dass der Versuch, ehemalige Dschihadisten zu resozialisieren, teuer wird. Es ist der Versuch, "Zeitbomben", wie er sie nennt, zu entschÃ¤rfen. Vor allem, wenn sie wie Suliman al-S. auch von Deutschland aus noch Kontakt gehalten haben zu ihren Kumpanen, wie Campeau sagt.

Aber er findet, die Gesellschaft habe keine andere Wahl, als "gute Imame" zu suchen, die die Dschihadisten religiÃ¶s aufklÃ¤ren. Und Psychiater zu bezahlen, die ihnen helfen, ihre eigenen Traumata aufzuarbeiten.

Campeau hÃ¤lt nich alle seiner EntfÃ¼hrer fÃ¼r schlechte Menschen

Der Vater von inzwischen drei Kindern sucht, tastet nach Worten, wenn er Ã¼ber seine EntfÃ¼hrer spricht oder schreibt. Ãœberhaupt, wenn er Ã¼ber Menschen urteilen soll.

Denn eines will er unbedingt vermeiden: Er will nicht in so eine Spirale des Hasses geraten wie viele seiner EntfÃ¼hrer. Er wollte nie so undifferenziert urteilen wie viele von ihnen.

"Wenn ich Abneigung oder Hass empfinde, dann nicht so sehr gegen meine Kidnapper, sondern gegen ihre Ideologie", sagt er. "Es ist eine totalitÃ¤re Ideologie."

Nicht alle seiner EntfÃ¼hrer seien schlechte Menschen. "Es gibt GrÃ¼nde, warum sie in diese Sache hineingeraten sind und manchmal gute GrÃ¼nde."

Campeau erzÃ¤hlt von einem jungen Mann, der von Soldaten gefangen und drei Monate jeden Tag gefoltert wurde, bevor er sich den Rebellen anschloss. Er findet die Reaktion nachvollziehbar. Rebellion an sich sei auch nicht das Problem. "Aber man muss sich fragen, was diese Rebellion erreichen will."

Junge Menschen aber hÃ¤tten oft nicht die Weisheit, das zu sehen.

Gratwanderung zwischen Selbstaufgabe und Hass

Was der Jurist da macht, ist eine schwierige Gratwanderung. Eine auf einem Grat zwischen AbgrÃ¼nden aus Stockholm-Syndrom und Islamhass.

Und nicht immer gelingt Campeau das. In seinem Buch "Meine Seele kriegt ihr nie" schreibt er, dass er immer wieder SÃ¤tze durchstreichen musste, in denen die GefÃ¼hle stÃ¤rker wurden als der Verstand. Aber diese "intellektuelle Faulheit", wie er es nennt, wollte und will er sich nicht gestatten.

Denn dann, so empfindet er es, hÃ¤tten seine Kidnapper gewonnen. Sie hÃ¤tten nicht nur acht Monate die Gewalt Ã¼ber seinen KÃ¶rper gehabt, sondern lebenslang Ã¼ber seine Seele.

"Ich hÃ¤tte keinen Unschuldigen getÃ¶tet"

"Ich fragte mich nicht nur einmal, wer hier eigentlich in Wahrheit der Gefangene war. Inzwischen scheint mir die Antwort klar", schreibt er in seinem Buch Ã¼ber die EntfÃ¼hrung.

"Wenn sie mich gezwungen hÃ¤tten, einen Unschuldigen zu tÃ¶ten oder eine Frau zu vergewaltigen, das hÃ¤tte ich nicht getan, nur um meine Haut zu retten", sagt er im GesprÃ¤ch mit der HuffPost. Denn mit so einer Tat hÃ¤tte er immer leben mÃ¼ssen. "Und wenn man an das Leben nach dem Tod glaubt, dann kÃ¶nnte es da auch Konsequenzen geben."

Die verzweifelte Hoffnung auf Hilfe, wenn schon nicht von Menschen, dann vom Erzengel

Campeau hÃ¤lt sich nicht fÃ¼r einen besonders religiÃ¶sen Menschen. Aber in der Verzweiflung fing er an zu beten. "Ich dachte mir, was habe ich zu verlieren?"

TatsÃ¤chlich hÃ¤tte er sein Leben verloren, wenn die EntfÃ¼hrer gemerkt hÃ¤tten, zu wem er da betete.

Aber Campeau bat den Erzengel Michael, er mÃ¶ge ihm die Flucht ermÃ¶glichen.

Am 16. Oktober, einem hohen muslimischen Feiertag, vergaÃŸen die EntfÃ¼hrer dann tatsÃ¤chlich, die TÃ¼r zu seinem Zimmer abzusperren und verschwanden zum Sporttraining. Campeau floh zu FuÃŸ durch die zerbombten, zerschossenen StraÃŸen, rannte und wanderte Stunden, bis er auf Soldaten des Regimes traf, die ihn erst fÃ¼r einen Spion hielten. Erst nach langen Befragungen lieÃŸen sie ihn frei.

"Es ist egal, ob der Erzengel eine Idee oder Wirklichkeit ist, denn es hat mir geholfen, ihn um Hilfe zu bitten", sagt Campeau. "Es hat mir Hoffnung gegeben."

Als der 53-JÃ¤hrige diese SÃ¤tze gesagt hat, bleibt es eine kurze Weile still im Raum. So beherrscht er Ã¼ber seine Erfahrungen spricht, so ruhig, so sehr quÃ¤lt ihn die Erinnerung, die ihm noch immer den Schlaf raubt. Und die jetzt seine Augen feucht werden lÃ¤sst.

"Ich hÃ¤tte ihn gern gefragt, ob es ihm gut geht"

Er weiÃŸ nicht, was passiert ist, nachdem er geflohen ist. Wann seine EntfÃ¼hrer es gemerkt haben, ob sie ihm auf den Fersen waren.

Er hat nach seiner RÃ¼ckkehr jedoch eine Anfrage Ã¼ber Facebook bekommen. Er vermutet, dass sie von einem der EntfÃ¼hrer ist, wohl von einem, den er als einen der "guten" in Erinnerung hat. "Ich hÃ¤tte ihn gern gefragt, ob es ihm gut geht", sagt Campeau. Aber aus SicherheitsgrÃ¼nden lieÃŸ er es bleiben.

Um der Sicherheit willen darf die Ã–ffentlichkeit auch nicht wissen, wo die UN ihn jetzt eingesetzt haben.

Seine Seele, die haben sie wohl nicht bekommen

Er arbeitet noch immer fÃ¼r die Organisation, die ihn nach seiner EinschÃ¤tzung so hÃ¤ngen lieÃŸ, als sein Leben davon abhing. Die zulieÃŸ, dass eine Ehefrau maÃŸgeblich die Verhandlungen fÃ¼hren musste mit EntfÃ¼hrern und BehÃ¶rden.

Selbst der Richter, der Suliman al-S. in Stuttgart verurteilte, machte den UN und dem kanadischen Geheimdienst laut der "Stuttgarter Zeitung" massive VorwÃ¼rfe: "Man mag es kaum glauben, aber die UN hat kein Interesse daran gezeigt, die EntfÃ¼hrung ihres Mitarbeiters aufzuklÃ¤renâ€œ, so Richter Anderer.

Am 17. Oktober 2013, einen Tag nach der Flucht, Ã¼bergibt der syrische Vize-AuÃŸenminister Faisal al-Makdad (r.) Campeau (M.) in die Obhut an den UN-Vertreter Yacoub El Hillo. Foto: Reuters.

"Ich arbeite noch dort, weil ich eine Familie habe und eine Job brauche. Und weil ich an die Ideale der UN glaube, daran, dass man die Menschen unterstÃ¼tzen und Staaten ein Diskussionsforum bieten muss."

Wer Campeau so zuhÃ¶rt, der hÃ¶rt einen ebenso rationalen wie verletzlichen Menschen, der viel Dinge erlebt hat, die niemand jemals hÃ¤tte erleben sollen. Aber er hÃ¶rt eben immer noch einen Menschen. Einen, dessen Seele die EntfÃ¼hrer verwundet haben. Aber bestimmt nicht besiegt.

Mit der AfD als drittstÃ¤rkste Kraft im Bundestag wÃ¤chst auch ein parlamentarisches Streitpotential heran, dass alle Harmonie verwÃ¶hnten Menschen zu Denken geben sollte. Glaubt man den Worten eines gewissen "Gauland", man wolle andersdenkende (Politiker) kÃ¼nftig "JAGEN", weckt das eine durchaus unschÃ¶ne Assoziation zur frÃ¼heren Vergangenheit dieses Landes. Vor allem dann, wenn man sich vorstellt, dass LINKS und RECHTS so neu erstarkt dann irgendwann auf der StraÃŸe aufeinanderprallen. Die AfD forderte unlÃ¤ngst ja die Bewaffnung eines jeden BÃ¼rgers und nicht Wenige gehen davon aus, dass am 6. Juli am Hamburg Fischmarkt sogar die AufstandsbekÃ¤mpfung geprobt, respektive trainiert wurde - und zwar am lebenden Objekt.

Eine Zusammenfassung von Max Bryan

Im vorangegangenen Bericht zur "WELCOME TO HELL"-Demo sahen wir, wie die Versammlung am 6. Juli mit unbilliger HÃ¤rte aufgelÃ¶st wurde und warum die Gesamteinsatzleitung sich dafÃ¼r explizit den Raum an der Flutschutzmauer aussuchte, um die Vermummten dort zu stellen.
