TEXT:
Capturing The Theatre Of London Fashion Week SS2017: Days One And Two I've been shooting London Fashion Week for over a decade. I love it. The showmanship and the glamour make it one of the highlights of my year. It's always been so theatrical. Take Vivienne Westwood's most recent Men's London Fashion Week: it was all acrobats - even clowns - and energy. Getty Images Entertainment Photographer capturing all major EU events from London Fashion Week to Cannes Film Festival and the MTV Awards.

Is #IWWIWWIWI Changing Fashion Week As We Know It? It may not be the most well-known hashtag, but the rise in popularity of the 'I want what I want when I want it' attitude is no secret. Shoppers don't want to fall in love with a dress and have to wait six months for it to be in season and on the rack. As a result, we're seeing the rise of "seasonless fashion" in every market and at every price point. As Director of Retail at Salesforce, Chris works with UK enterprise retail customers to help digitally transform their customer experience

Why Equality On The Runway Needs To Happen Now Now, with the most glitz and glam event in the fashion calendar just around the corner, it's time to scream about diversity, not whisper. In my eyes, the sooner we see a catwalk that is full of a variety of women, the better. Although small steps are undeniably a positive thing, it's time to strive for bigger leaps to be made to include women of every race, age, shape and size. Fashion, beauty and lifestyle blogger.

Muslim Fashion And Muslim Clothing Is Not A Uniform: How Diverse Is The Modest Fashion Industry? Offering a professional platform to exalt modest fashion designers in London was no coincidence. Organiser of LMFW, Franka Soeria said, "London is one of the trendiest places for modest fashion" in the West with a large supportive community. student, community activist, aspiring journalist

Sabinna Experiments With Mixed Reality Shopping For Fashion For Sabinna Rachimova, her 'brand DNA' is, actually, familial. It transcends ethos and aesthetics and runs deep into the past, through two generations of her family. Her grandmother, a maths and physics professor in her native Russia, who during communist times made clothing on the side for neighbours and friends for extra income, inspired her to pursue a career in art and craft. Fashion Tech Innovator. Co-Director, BR Innovation Agency (BRIA)

International Fashion Showcase Takes London Fashion Week Global There's a huge amount to see at London Fashion Week every season, but pausing and pondering regional design talent and forces in countries around the ... Fashion Tech Innovator. Co-Director, BR Innovation Agency (BRIA)

A Round-Up Of London Fashion Week AW17 Street Style Nothing can stop the force that is Fashion Week. Come rain or shine, this couldn't keep the fashion's street style stars at bay as they marched throughout the streets of London Fashion Week. It was a chaotic few days, but London Fashion Week is officially over for another year (we'll for another six months) to be precise. Blogger & Digital Influencer & Fashion Host

London Begins To Embrace Diversity In Fashion London Fashion Week is a must for any fashion junky's diary. A place to see and be seen, the wacky and the wild, the classy and the chic, and let's not forgetting some celebrities perched on the FROW of each show. Model, Makeup artist and blogger for Models of Diversity

Phoebe English's Collection Sparks A Conversation Of Unity, But Where Are My Hijab-Wearing Sisters At London Fashion Week? My closing thoughts rest on the rising global voices in fashion that originate from vastly different cultures and belief systems, and that speak on behalf of under-represented groups. I want to sit at shows and presentations alongside men and women representing all colours, faiths and styles Fashion Tech Innovator. Co-Director, BR Innovation Agency (BRIA)

Exclusive, Unattainable And Indulgent. Should We Care About Fashion Week? You are hoping that the winter days will start coming to an end, that your well worn jeans and jumpers will get a break and this summer you will really embrace feminine dressing that you say you will do every year. However it appears that the fashionista's of the world don't appear to have to worry about what to cook the kids for dinner, cleaning the bathroom or getting the boiler fixed. Style & Confidence Coach. Inspiring women with their style, wardrobe organisation & outfitting to help them redefine their story. www.thestylingstorey.co.uk

Wonder What It's Like To Be A Model For A Day? The world of modelling is evolving for the better. Here's why: you don't need to be 5'10" and above, size 0 and always on a diet, to strut your stuff on the catwalk. And the same goes for those models in editorial high fashion photo spreads, thanks to the new way. All good news for me since I am not 5'10" and I am not size 0. Actress, Singer, Dancer, Fashionista, Movie Critic, Healthy Baker, Opinionator, and Girl About Town (London, that is!)
TITLE: HuffPost UK London Fashion Week: The Latest News, Blogs, Trend Pieces And Interviews

TEXT:
The head of the National Rifle Associationâ€™s lobbying arm said Thursday that â€œgun control is a failed policyâ€ and itâ€™s time to have a broader conversation about the underlying problem of mass shootings â€” namely the role Hollywood has played by fetishizing firearms.

â€³The NRA spends millions of dollars every year teaching safe and responsible gun ownership, and Hollywood makes billions promoting and glorifying gun violence,â€ Chris Cox, executive director of NRAâ€™s Institute for Legislative Action, told Fox Newsâ€™ Tucker Carlson. â€œAnd then the same hypocrites come in and suggest weâ€™re to blame for this.â€

Cox of course was referring to the massacre Sunday night in Las Vegas, in which a lone gunman rained bullets down onto a country music festival, killing at least 58 people and injuring hundreds more before turning the gun on himself. The shooterâ€™s arsenal included 12 firearms outfitted with bump fire stocks, devices that effectively allow a semi-automatic weapon to function as a fully automatic one does.

In an out-of-character move for the NRA, on Thursday â€” following several days of silence â€” the group issued a statement in which it acknowledged such devices â€œshould be subject to additional regulations.â€

Echoing a statement he and NRA CEO Wayne LaPierre had made earlier in the day, Cox told Fox News it was the Obama administration that approved the sale of bump fire stocks, and called on the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives to â€œdo their job.â€

â€œWe didnâ€™t talk about banning anything,â€ he told Carlson. â€œWe talked about ATF going back and reviewing whether these are in compliance with federal law.â€

Along with pointing the finger at the Obama administration, ATF and Hollywood, Cox questioned whether prescription drugs are influencing gun violence.

Asked by Carlson what has changed since they were children to allow for an increase in deadly shootings, Cox said: â€œThatâ€™s a conversation thatâ€™s happening at dinner tables and in living rooms all over the country. Iâ€™m sure itâ€™s happened in yours, itâ€™s certainly happened in mine. And I donâ€™t know the answer. And I think we need to look at the broader conversation, and have a broader conversation, about a violent culture, about what has happened with gratuitous violence out of Hollywood, whatâ€™s happened with prescription drugs.â€

Like the rest of the country, the NRA is looking for answers, Cox said. And while the gun rights advocacy group wants â€œto be part of a constructive conversation,â€ that conversation must include respecting the rights of law-abiding citizens and allowing them to protect themselves, he said.

â€œWeâ€™re focused on keeping Congress out of Second Amendment freedoms, keeping Congress focused on expanding the rights of law-abiding people to protect themselves and their families,â€ he said.

â€œAllow good, honest people the ability to defend themselves. Pass reforms like National Right to Carry Reciprocity.â€ â€“@ChrisCoxNRA #2A #NRA pic.twitter.com/9un5x1lcNs â€” NRATV (@NRATV) October 6, 2017

In a separate interview with Fox Newsâ€™ Sean Hannity on Thursday night, LaPierre touted the money the NRA spends teaching gun safety, and bashed Hollywood and the â€œelitesâ€ in Washington, D.C.

â€œThis Hollywood crowd makes billions ... teaching gun irresponsibility to the American public,â€ he said. â€œThe hypocrisy is beyond belief. They criticize me for saying people ought to be able to protect themselves from murderers, rapists and robbers, and then they make billions depicting every night those same situations.â€

Like Cox, LaPierre said the NRA had suggested the ATF take a second look at bump fire stocks, but stressed he and Cox â€œdidnâ€™t say banâ€ and â€œdidnâ€™t say confiscate.â€ He added that tightening gun laws would not prove effective at stopping shootings like the one in Las Vegas.

â€œIf legislation worked, Boston massacre wouldnâ€™t have happened, San Bernardino â€” where California has every gun law on the books â€” that wouldnâ€™t have happened,â€ La Pierre said. â€œIn Paris, where they have complete gun bans, that wouldnâ€™t have happened. Brussels. All over the world, where the people are disarmed, these monsters, these bad guys, go about their business. They could care less about what laws are on the books.â€
TITLE: NRA Points Finger At Hollywood For Mass Shootings

Wie dieses Dilemma in der Wirklichkeit dann aussieht, sahen ARD-Zuschauer im August bei â€œHart aber fairâ€. Zu Gast war damals der Spitzenkandidat Alexander Gauland. Kurz zuvor hatte er fÃ¼r einen Skandal gesorgt, als er sagte, die Integrationsbeauftragte Aydan Ã–zoguz kÃ¶nne in Anatolien entsorgt werden.

"Wie dÃ¤mlich muss man denn sein..." - Plasberg in der Kritik

Immer wieder versuchte Gauland, den Fragen Plasbergs auszuweichen. Journalisten wie "Welt"-Autor Thomas Schmid empÃ¶rten sich hinterher, dass die â€œHart aber fairâ€-Redaktion Gauland Ã¼berhaupt eine BÃ¼hne geboten habe.

â€œWie dÃ¤mlich muss man denn sein, einem solchen kÃ¼hl kalkulierenden Provokateur, der sich als Unschuldslamm gibt, einen derart breiten und fÃ¼r Gaulands Partei unbezahlbaren Ã¶ffentlich-rechtlichen Wahlkampfauftritt zu verschaffenâ€, schimpfte Schmid damals in einem Facebook-Post.

Im â€œSpiegelâ€-Interview schildert Plasberg, die Redaktion habe das ganze Wochenende vor der Sendung mit Gauland Ã¼berlegt, ob sie den Politiker ausladen solle.

Plasberg hat keine eindeutige Antwort parat

Eine eindeutige Antwort auf die Frage nach dem richtigen Umgang mit der AfD kann Plasberg nicht geben. Sollte die AfD wie jede andere Partei behandelt werden?

â€œJa. Und neinâ€, antwortet Plasberg da. Es wÃ¼rden jedenfalls die gleichen journalistischen Standards gelten. Man dÃ¼rfe der AfD nicht den Gefallen tun, â€œeine spezielle Umgangsweise fÃ¼r sie zu entwickelnâ€.

Dass AfD-Politiker als Talkshow-GÃ¤ste allerdings doch eine "besondere Vorbereitung" brÃ¤uchten, wie Redaktionsleiter Diedenhofen sagt, oder einen "besonderen Energieaufwand", wie Plasberg meint, zeigt, wie schwer den Medien der Umgang mit den Rechtspopulisten doch fÃ¤llt.

Plasberg verrÃ¤t auch, was die Zuschauer der Sendung nicht mehr sahen, als Gauland eingeladen war.

Gauland privat nach der Sendung

Nach der Aufzeichnung sei er zu dem Politiker gegangen und habe ihm erklÃ¤rt:

"Ab heuÂ­te bin ich jeÂ­dem bÃ¶se, der dieÂ­se ParÂ­tei wÃ¤hlt, nachÂ­dem er Sie, Herr GauÂ­land, heuÂ­te bei 'Hart aber fair' geÂ­seÂ­hen hat."

Gauland sei klug, rhetorisch fit, verleugne aber seine eigene IntellektualitÃ¤t, wenn er sage, "er habe nicht geÂ­wusst, was der BeÂ­griff â€˜EntÂ­sorÂ­genâ€™ beÂ­deuÂ­tet."

Gauland habe nur dagestanden, mit einem Glas in der Hand und habe das "mit groÃŸer Gelassenheit zur Kenntnis" genommen.

(ujo)
TITLE: "Die AfD spielt anders": "Hart aber fair"-Moderator Plasberg Ã¼ber den schwierigen Umgang mit Gauland

SUMMARY:
â€œGleeâ€ star Mark Salling pleaded guilty to possession of child pornography involving prepubescent minors as part of a plea deal on Wednesday, according to court documents obtained by Deadline.
He must register as a sex offender and is banned from communication with anyone under age 18 without a legal guardian or parent present.
After his release, Salling will be restricted from going within 100 feet of schoolyards, parks, public swimming pools, playgrounds, video arcades or any place frequented by minors.
He must also enroll in a sex offender treatment program.
The decision comes more than a year after Salling pleaded not guilty following a federal grand jury indictment on two counts of possessing child pornography.
TEXT:
Vivien Killilea via Getty Images Mark Salling attends an event in 2015.

â€œGleeâ€ star Mark Salling pleaded guilty to possession of child pornography involving prepubescent minors as part of a plea deal on Wednesday, according to court documents obtained by Deadline.

The 35-year-old actor could face four to seven years in prison followed by up to 20 years of supervised release. He must register as a sex offender and is banned from communication with anyone under age 18 without a legal guardian or parent present. Salling will also pay $50,000 in restitution to each victim who requested it.

The actor was arrested in December 2015 on suspicion of possessing â€œhundredsâ€ of images plus two videos featuring underage girls on his personal computer after his ex-girlfriend reportedly alerted authorities. In fact, federal investigators discovered tens of thousands of pornographic images and hundreds of videos with children ages 2â€“6 on a hard drive, according to court documents.

After his release, Salling will be restricted from going within 100 feet of schoolyards, parks, public swimming pools, playgrounds, video arcades or any place frequented by minors. He must also enroll in a sex offender treatment program.

The decision comes more than a year after Salling pleaded not guilty following a federal grand jury indictment on two counts of possessing child pornography. The trial, however, was delayed as he sought new legal representation.

While the charges sent shockwaves through the â€œGleeâ€ fandom at the time of his arrest, co-star and former girlfriend, Naya Rivera, wasnâ€™t entirely surprised.

â€œHe always was a very dark soul to me,â€ Rivera told Entertainment Tonight about Salling. â€œI just always felt like there was something he was wrestling with.â€
TITLE: 'Glee' Actor Mark Salling Pleads Guilty To Child Pornography Charges

Je participerai avec 23 Ã©lu-es Ã  la crÃ©ation d'un nouveau groupe Ã©cologiste et solidaire Ã  la rÃ©gion @iledefrance â€” BenoÃ®t Hamon (@benoithamon) 6 octobre 2017

SUMMARY:

TEXT:
Theresa May stepping down as prime minister would not solve the Toriesâ€™ â€œBrexit catastropheâ€, according to Parliamentâ€™s only Green MP.

Caroline Lucas said Mayâ€™s disastrous party conference speech must have been â€œan excruciating experienceâ€, but that her resignation - being called for by a number of Conservative MPs, led by former party chairman Grant Shapps - would fail to address any problems.

Speaking to HuffPost UK ahead of the Greensâ€™ annual conference, which kicks off this weekend, Lucas said: â€œOn a personal level my heart goes out to her, in the sense that it was clearly an excruciating experience that you wouldnâ€™t wish on anybody. Having said that, the real disaster of that speech was not the prime ministerâ€™s cough, but more what was in the speech and a complete failure to address the overwhelmingly important issues of the day.

â€œOn housing, for example, the idea that an extra five thousand council houses a year is really going to go anywhere towards addressing the absolute housing crisis that we face is just for the birds and a demonstration of just how out of touch the Tories are.

Empics Entertainment Theresa May struggles through her conference speech

â€œThe content of the speech was what was so incredibly disheartening - the lack of vision and the lack of any kind of understanding about what people want to hear.

â€œThey are well aware that they face a problem, that they need to be attracting more young people to their cause, and yet what they were offering was just so insignificant and unhelpful, itâ€™s really hard to see what they were thinking.â€

Lucas, who is co-leader of her own party, said changing the leadership of the Conservative party would do nothing to address â€œthis absolute Brexit catastrophe at its heartâ€.

â€œWhoever takes over from Theresa is still going to have that same challenge,â€ she added.

â€œThey have obviously got a completely split parliamentary party on the issue, they canâ€™t keep the same line more than a couple of days and the negotiations themselves seem to be going incredibly badly.

â€œWhen youâ€™ve got the CBI themselves saying to the Conservative Party â€˜pull yourselves together, youâ€™re incompetent and incoherentâ€™, that surely demonstrates just what an abysmal state the party is in, so changing leader isnâ€™t going to help them.â€

Empics Entertainment The Greens want a 'ratification referendum' on Brexit

The Greens have long been pushing for a â€˜ratification referendumâ€™ on Brexit - a second chance for voters to decide whether they really want Britain to leave the EU once exit negotiations are complete.

Lucas said she hoped MPs from other parties who were concerned about the Brexit process would back her proposal for a second vote.

â€œWe need to banish any ideas of this extreme Brexit, that no deal is better than a bad deal, all of this empty rhetoric that does not bear any scrutiny, because itâ€™s quite clear that no deal would be an asbolute disaster for the economy,â€ she said.

â€œGet rid of that and look very seriously at the proposals for remaining inside the single market and maintaining freedom of movement.

â€œOne way that both parties [Labour and Conservatives] could square the circle of the dilemma they have at the moment in terms of split views is to support the Green proposal for a ratification referendum.

â€œThe process was started by the British people, who voted [Leave] by a narrow majority, and it feels to me that it should go back to them to have the final sign-off.

â€œIf they like what they see, fine, but if they donâ€™t, and if on balance they would prefer to remain inside the EU now they are equipped with an awful lot more information than they had when they voted to leave, then they should have the final say.â€

PA Archive/PA Images Caroline Lucas and Jonathan Bartley

Lucas, who job shares her leadership position with former Parliamentary hopeful Jonathan Bartley, said she hoped the hung parliament produced as a result of the 2017 election would afford her more chances to work with rival MPs.

â€œOne positive thing I have discovered about Westminster is that contrary to some of the appearances, it is possible to work cross-party on a case-by-case basis.

â€œYou can make headway on different issues and that obviously is crucial, because none of the opposition parties on their own are going to be enough - so we need to work together.â€

The Greens have so far enjoyed a surprisingly civil working relationship with environment secretary Michael Gove, who since returning to the cabinet has pledged to champion a number of environmental issues, including animal welfare, air quality and tackling climate change.

â€œTo his credit he does appear to want to make his mark on this department which is good, because recently we have had ministers who didnâ€™t seem to care very much about the brief they have been given,â€ Lucas said.

â€œHe is a big beast and he wants to make his mark, and as long as he is doing that in a positive way, then thatâ€™s great.

Leon Neal via Getty Images Caroline Lucas says environment secretary Michael Gove is a 'big beast'

â€œThat does not wipe clean his own voting record in this area - which has been far from positive - and there are plenty of challenges in terms of how he is going to square this new found environmental zeal with the fact the government is continuing to promote fracking and nuclear energy and airport expansion and HS2 and road-building and all of those other things.

â€œOn the one hand, the idea that Gove is turning the Conservative Party into the real Green Party is genuinely laughable, but on the other hand, if we do now have somebody in that department who for whatever reason, whether they believe in it or not, is willing to be more positive and engage more seriously with these issues then thatâ€™s good, but the jury is out to see which way it goes.â€

She said the Green conference, which is being held in Harrogate, Yorkshire, will focus on Brexit and its impact on the environment as its main theme.

Bartley will be in the spotlight as he delivers the leadersâ€™ speech on Monday, and among policy motions to be voted on are proposals for a new bank holiday to celebrate â€œthe contribution of migrants and people of colourâ€ and enabling Parliamentary candidates to remain in place up to 18 months after a general election without being subjected to a new selection process.

Lucas said: â€œOurs is a very democratic, grassroots, bottom-up party, so essentially our policy is made by our members.
TITLE: Caroline Lucas: Theresa May Quitting Cannot Solve Tories' Brexit Catastrophe

TEXT:
OURAGAN - La tempÃªte tropicale Nate, qui fait route vers les Etats-Unis, s'est transformÃ©e ce samedi 7 octobre en ouragan de catÃ©gorie 1, aprÃ¨s avoir fait au moins 28 morts et causÃ© d'importants dommages lors de son passage en AmÃ©rique centrale.

"Nate s'est transformÃ©e en ouragan", a annoncÃ© vers 7 heures le Centre national des ouragans (NHC) amÃ©ricain alors que Nate longeait la cÃ´te caribÃ©enne du Mexique et se trouvait Ã  environ 150 km au nord de l'extrÃ©mitÃ© occidentale de Cuba.

L'ouragan se trouve en catÃ©gorie 1 sur les 5 que compte l'Ã©chelle Saffir-Simpson. Selon le Service MÃ©tÃ©orologique national du Mexique (SMN), Nate se dÃ©place Ã  35 km/h avec des pointes de vent jusqu'Ã  150 km/h et devrait toucher les Etats-Unis aux premiÃ¨res heures de dimanche.

Couvres feu et suspension des cours d'Ã©cole

Au Mexique, le gouverneur de l'Etat de Quintana Roo, qui comprend la rÃ©gion touristique de Cancun, avait suspendu les cours dans les Ã©coles dÃ¨s vendredi aprÃ¨s-midi, Carlos Joaquin demandant Ã  la population de "ne pas baisser la garde" car, mÃªme si Nate ne devrait pas atteindre le territoire mexicain, elle pourrait provoquer de fortes pluies.

En anticipation de son passage dans le Golfe du Mexique, des plateformes pÃ©troliÃ¨res et gaziÃ¨res ont Ã©tÃ© Ã©vacuÃ©es. Les autoritÃ©s de la Nouvelle-OrlÃ©ans, en Louisiane dans le sud-est des Etats-Unis, ont imposÃ© un couvre-feu vendredi aprÃ¨s-midi ainsi que des mesures d'Ã©vacuation obligatoire et volontaire dans certaines zones de basse altitude, particuliÃ¨rement vulnÃ©rables aux inondations.

"Notre plus grande menace n'est pas forcÃ©ment la pluie mais les vents et les vagues", a dÃ©clarÃ© le maire de la Nouvelle-OrlÃ©ans, Mitch Landrieu. "Nous anticipons son impact", a indiquÃ© le gouverneur de la Louisiane, John Bel Edwards, qui a dÃ©clarÃ© l'Ã©tat d'urgence.

Le sud-est des Etats-Unis a dÃ©jÃ  Ã©tÃ© durement frappÃ© en aoÃ»t par deux ouragans: Harvey au Texas et en Louisiane, qui a fait 42 morts et causÃ© des dÃ©gÃ¢ts matÃ©riels considÃ©rables, et Irma, qui, aprÃ¨s avoir traversÃ© les Antilles, a atteint la catÃ©gorie 5 et fait 12 morts en Floride.

L'AmÃ©rique centrale dÃ©vastÃ©e

Ponts dÃ©truits, routes inondÃ©es, arbres au sol et glissements de terrain: Nate a causÃ© de lourds dÃ©gÃ¢ts lors de son passage en AmÃ©rique centrale. Le Costa Rica, le Nicaragua et le Honduras, les pays les plus durement touchÃ©s, commenÃ§aient Ã  Ã©valuer les dÃ©gÃ¢ts alors que les pluies semblaient cÃ©der le pas.

Sous la violence de la tempÃªte, des villages entiers Ã©taient coupÃ©s du monde dans plusieurs pays de la rÃ©gion. Selon les derniers bilans officiels des services de secours, la tempÃªte a fait 13 morts au Nicaragua, 10 au Costa Rica, trois au Honduras et deux au Salvador. Et ce bilan n'est que provisoire. Au Costa Rica, les Ã©quipes de secours recherchaient plus de 30 personnes disparues et plus de 5000 ont dÃ» trouver refuge dans des abris.

Le prÃ©sident Luis Guillermo Solis a dÃ©crÃ©tÃ© trois jours de deuil national en hommage aux dix personnes tuÃ©es, dont une fillette de trois ans emportÃ©e par une coulÃ©e de boue. MalgrÃ© la lÃ©gÃ¨re accalmie sur le front des pluies, Guillermo Solis a prÃ©venu que le risque d'inondations et de glissements de terrain persistait. "Nous avons fait une Ã©valuation trÃ¨s dÃ©taillÃ©e de la situation climatique, elle est en amÃ©lioration, sauf dans le nord-ouest et le sud. Cette situation est trompeuse car il va pleuvoir ce week-end et les sols sont saturÃ©s, donc les glissements de terrain sont possibles", a-t-il prÃ©venu.

AprÃ¨s la tempÃªte, le danger des crocodiles

Dans ce pays, des villages situÃ©s sur la cÃ´te Pacifique restaient inondÃ©s vendredi matin alors que les Ã©quipes de secours cherchaient les personnes portÃ©es disparues. Le gouvernement costaricien a par ailleurs appelÃ© la population Ã  prendre des prÃ©cautions car les crocodiles vivant dans les riviÃ¨res cÃ´tiÃ¨res peuvent s'approcher des maisons Ã  cause des inondations.

Le Nicaragua semble le pays le plus touchÃ© par la tempÃªte avec, d'aprÃ¨s la vice-prÃ©sidente et porte-parole du gouvernement, Rosario Murillo, plus de 10.000 personnes affectÃ©es par des inondations et coulÃ©es de boue. Des milliers de familles restaient privÃ©es d'Ã©lectricitÃ© vendredi matin.

La rÃ©gion CaraÃ¯bes, en pleine saison des pluies, est encore sous le traumatisme des ouragans Irma, JosÃ© et Maria qui n'ont cessÃ© de la frapper ces derniÃ¨res semaines, laissant des paysages de dÃ©solation et de nombreuses victimes derriÃ¨re eux.

TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Earlier this week, a 13-year-old jumped from the 11th floor of an apartment building to escape the beating and torture that she had endured for two years, exposing a horrific case of bonded labour in Faridabad, Haryana.

The minor fell through a bird net and landed in a balcony on the 10th floor of the Kanishka Towers in Faridabad, where she lay in a semiconscious state for seven hours until she was rescued by residents.

The teenager, who had worked as a domestic for two years in a rented apartment on the 11th floor, was allegedly beaten and tortured by her employer - a woman in her early twenties. The Times of India reported today that the survivor's body is marked by deep gashes, scratches, wounds on the head and burn marks on the back.

Rishi Kant, spokesperson of Shakti Vahini, an NGO that combats bonded labour in the country, told News 18, "The victim has burn marks all over her back, she has bruises on her head and her hands have deep marks that appear old. The girl is extremely scared and is in a traumatic condition. Doctors say she has been starved for long."

"The girl said the woman would hit her with pipes and rolling pins. If she made a mistake, boiling water would be thrown on her back. The evident injuries and burn marks all over her body confirm this," Kant told The Indian Express.

One neighbor said, "We would often hear cries. But the woman, who told us that she studies at a private university, would tell us to mind our own business."

The teenager, who hails from Bihar, has been sent to a Child Protection Home but the police are struggling to locate her parents in Patna.

The accused, who also hails from Bihar and is pursuing a BTech degree at Manav Rachna University in Faridabad, has been arrested and remanded in judicial custody. An FIR has been registered against her under Section 79 of the Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act, 2015.

H.S. Malik, chairperson of the Child Welfare Committee, Faridabad, HS Malik, told News 18, "The accused is a student a private university in Faridabad. She used to beat up the girl regularly. Both the girls hail from Patna and the parents of the victim work as servants at the accused girl's home in Bihar."

The Indian Express reported that the accused has been identified as Sneha, whose father owns mines in Bihar.

TOI reported that the teenager, who was performing all the household chores including sweeping, cooking, and washing clothes, was not paid a salary.

Also on HuffPost India:
TITLE: Enslaved Minor Jumps From 11th Floor In Faridabad To Escape Torture

TEXT:
No habÃ­an pasado ni 10 aÃ±os del terremoto del 85 cuando fui a la colonia Roma, a un 'toquÃ­n'. Fue la primera vez que vi, en vivo y a todo color, ruinas de edificios. Estar ahÃ­ sonaba a una gran aventura urbana, como aquellas anÃ©cdotas de la Alemania postmuro, en donde se celebraban conciertos de metal en edificios derruidos.

Pero cuando le contÃ© a mi hermano mayor mi heroica visita, se enojÃ³ muchÃ­simo. En los aÃ±os 90, ir a la colonia Roma o a la Condesa sonaba a suicidio: ademÃ¡s de que las ruinas del sismo del 85 seguÃ­an ahÃ­, abandonadas, con el latente peligro de derrumbarse, la zona se habÃ­a convertido en cuna de asaltantes y traficantes de fayuca... al menos eso se decÃ­a en donde yo vivÃ­a (Villa Coapa).

Muy pocos aÃ±os despuÃ©s, cuando empecÃ© a trabajar, esos mismos lugares sonaban como el lugar perfecto para empezar a vivir solo o con amigos: antes del aÃ±o 2000 las rentas eran baratas, los lugares amplios y la zona cÃ©ntrica. Poco tiempo despuÃ©s llegÃ³ eso llamado plusvalÃ­a y la zona se volviÃ³ no solo cara sino saturada y caÃ³tica.

Aun asÃ­, muchos decidimos vivir en la periferia, en donde nunca habÃ­a pasado nada y en donde, hasta el 19 de septiembre del 2017, creÃ­amos que no pasarÃ­a nada nunca: la colonia del Valle.

Yo vivÃ­ una migraciÃ³n a la zona a finales de los aÃ±os 90: fuimos muchos veinteaÃ±eros que llegamos a rentar pequeÃ±os lugares, las mÃ¡s de las veces remodelados, que habÃ­an estado desocupados por aÃ±os. Eran baratos, cÃ³modos y nadie morÃ­a por arrebatÃ¡rtelos. En aquella Ã©poca todos mis vecinos eran como yo, parecÃ­a un campus universitario. Con el tiempo, comprar en la colonia no solo sonaba coherente, sino que era un gran negocio: el Ã¡rea subÃ­a su plusvalÃ­a cada aÃ±o hasta 20%. Estar ahÃ­ era garantÃ­a de que estabas haciendo una gran inversiÃ³n.

En aquella Ã©poca todos mis vecinos eran como yo, parecÃ­a un campus universitario.

Hoy, menos de 20 aÃ±os despuÃ©s, veo una segunda migraciÃ³n pero a la inversa: ahora todos parecen querer huir... y mientras mÃ¡s pronto, mejor.

Cierto. Hay Ã¡reas de la colonia del Valle que ni queriendo recuerdan que temblÃ³: estÃ¡n intactas. Pero para los que vivimos cerca de una zona cero y vimos edificios caer, la paranoia es difÃ­cil de ignorar. "En cualquier momento empezarÃ¡ a oler a muerto, asÃ­ pasÃ³ en el 85". "No tardan en llegar oleadas de ratas, que saldrÃ¡n de los escombros". "PrepÃ¡rense, van a llegar decenas de asaltos". AquÃ­ todos tienen algo catastrÃ³fico que decir: taxistas, tenderos, personal de basura, porteros... Si no ha llegado el Apocalipsis es porque aÃºn no ha habido tiempo. Y no es de a gratis: aÃºn hay muchas calles cerradas, edificios acordonados y agrietados, coronas de flores en muros derrumbados...

En mi edificio ya no quedamos ni la mitad de los vecinos. En los aledaÃ±os sucede lo mismo. Desde el 19 de septiembre es comÃºn ver gente que sale con maletas o que estÃ¡ sacado muebles. La mayorÃ­a no se despide, simplemente se va.

La zona que se caracterizaba por estar en constante movimiento de autos, ruido, puestos, cafÃ©s y negocios locales para trasnochadores se ha transformado en un pequeÃ±o pueblo cercado y silencioso.

No te vas porque serÃ­a como darse por vencido, Â¿no?", escucho decir al portero de mi edificio.

Va mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de eso: la oleada de gente que huye es tal, que encontrar un nuevo lugar cercano estÃ¡ resultando maratÃ³nico; no todos (por mÃ¡s que insistan que es zona de ricos) tienen recursos para pagar mudanza, depÃ³sitos y trÃ¡mites para rentar. Y los que son propietarios aÃºn evalÃºan quÃ© serÃ­a lo menos doloroso: abandonar su lugar mientras esperan que lo complicado se supere, o rematar su propiedad a precio de ganga para no volver jamÃ¡s. Habemos otros mÃ¡s que aÃºn estamos en esa fase de incredulidad, aÃºn no creemos todo lo que hemos visto.

Â¿A dÃ³nde se van todos?

Â¿QuÃ© colonias se van a saturar ahora? Â¿Y quÃ© pasarÃ¡ despuÃ©s en las zonas abandonadas? Infinidad de amigos me hacen saber que estÃ¡n en las mismas. Han escapado de Reforma, Polanco, la Roma y la Condesa, incluso de zonas en donde no pasÃ³ nada, pero que ya no suenan seguras: Tlalpan, DivisiÃ³n del Norte, Narvarte y NÃ¡poles. La mayorÃ­a se cambia solo 'a un ladito'... volver a empezar supongo que es mÃ¡s sencillo asÃ­.

Inmobiliarias han reportado que se ha incrementado su labor hasta 90%, sobre todo porque todos buscan mudarse a zonas aÃºn cÃ©ntricas, pero en edificios pequeÃ±os, o en un primer o segundo piso. Muchos mÃ¡s estÃ¡n dispuestos a venderlo todo para comprar algo fuera de la ciudad. Â¿CÃ³mo serÃ¡n los problemas de movilidad que tendremos con todo esto? Ya lo sabremos pronto.

Ayer que llegaba a casa, un vecino me detuvo. No estoy segura de haberlo visto nunca y creo que Ã©l tampoco sabÃ­a a ciencia cierta quiÃ©n era yo: solo necesitaba decirle adiÃ³s a alguien. "Me regreso a mi tierra, me dijeron que la capital era un peligro y aquÃ­ estoy yo de necio". Lo Ãºnico que se me ocurriÃ³ fue ofrecerme para tomarle una foto con su celular: "Para el recuerdo", le dije, "igual y dentro de poco regreses a este edificio a un concierto".

SUMMARY:
Tenants will have more power to own pets in Victoria.
The Victoria government has come good on its pledge to give tenants in the state a "fairer deal" as it prepares to unveil sweeping reforms to support renters across the state.
The Andrews Government will on Sunday reveal bold reforms to boost the power of tenants, including capping bonds that are paid to secure rental properties, NewsCorp Australia reports.
Big winners will also be renters with pets as the changes allow tenants to have a pet in their rental property.
There will also be a new Commissioner for Residential Tenancies, who will advocate on behalf of tenants, the ABC reports.
TEXT:
Tenants will have more power to own pets in Victoria.

The Victoria government has come good on its pledge to give tenants in the state a "fairer deal" as it prepares to unveil sweeping reforms to support renters across the state.

The Andrews Government will on Sunday reveal bold reforms to boost the power of tenants, including capping bonds that are paid to secure rental properties, NewsCorp Australia reports.

Big winners will also be renters with pets as the changes allow tenants to have a pet in their rental property. The reforms also outlaw landlords evicting tenants without a reason.

There will also be a new Commissioner for Residential Tenancies, who will advocate on behalf of tenants, the ABC reports.

A short note to the one in four Victorians who rent. pic.twitter.com/xltvRRZQEp â€” Daniel Andrews (@DanielAndrewsMP) October 7, 2017

Consumer Affairs Minister Marlene Kairouz said the changers were about protecting the one in four Victorians who rented.

New tenancy reforms to be announced by @VicGovAu. Bonds to be capped and it will be easier for tenants to have pets https://t.co/ycZMPo6JnJ â€” ABC News Melbourne (@abcnewsMelb) October 7, 2017

"More people are renting than ever before and for longer â€“ that's why tenants need a fairer deal," she told NewsCorp.
TITLE: Victorian Renters Get Boosted Pet Powers Under Sweeping Tenant Reforms

Et puis il y a le 17 novembre 1993. La terrible dÃ©sillusion du match France-Bulgarie avec ce but d'Emil Kostadinov dans les arrÃªts de jeu, donnant la victoire aux siens (1-2) alors que les Bleus n'avaient besoin que d'un point pour se qualifier pour la Coupe du monde 1994. "Croyez-moi, les Bulgares s'en souviennent. Ils n'ont pas oubliÃ©. Quand j'en discutais avec eux, ils me chambraient un peu", raconte le footballeur JÃ©rÃ©my Manzorro -ancien pensionnaire du championnat bulgare- Ã  LCI, en rappelant au passage que ce match constitue l'un des plus grands exploits du football bulgare.

Si de nombreux joueurs franÃ§ais n'Ã©taient pas nÃ©s en 1993, les fantÃ´mes de cette tragÃ©die footballistique ne manqueront pas de venir s'insinuer dans la conscience collective, ne serait-ce que par la prÃ©sence sur la pelouse d'un Kostadinov (Georgi) Ã©voquant le bourreau de 1993.

"A la maison, nous pouvons gagner contre toutes les Ã©quipes europÃ©ennes", assure le journaliste, louant l'Ã©tat d'esprit qui rÃ¨gne au sein de la sÃ©lection: "les joueurs n'ont pas de pression, ils n'ont rien Ã  perdre (...) et c'est dans ces moments-lÃ  que l'Ã©quipe joue bien".â€‹â€‹

MÃªme son de cloche du cÃ´tÃ© de CÃ©dric Bardon. L'ancien joueur franÃ§ais du Levski Sofia voit la sÃ©lection bulgare comme une Ã©quipe compacte avec "un ou deux trÃ¨s bons joueurs." Mais pour lui, la grande force de ces joueurs se retrouve surtout Ã  travers leur amour pour leur pays. Un sentiment qui anime beaucoup les sportifs des pays de l'est. "Tous les joueurs bulgares ont pour objectif ultime de jouer pour la sÃ©lection", explique l'ancien footballeur.

En face, pour se sortir de ce qui se prÃ©sente comme un "gros piÃ¨ge", les Bleus ne pourront pas compter sur plusieurs de leurs joueurs phares. Layvin Kurzawa, Benjamin Mendy, Paul Pogba, Laurent Koscielny ou encore la pÃ©pite Ousmane DembÃ©lÃ© manquent Ã  l'appel. Une cascade de forfaits qui pourrait jouer un rÃ´le dans ce match capital.

... au cÅ“ur d'une trÃ¨s chaude ambiance

D'autant que les Bulgares pourront Ã©galement compter sur un stade plein Ã  craquer, allÃ©chÃ© par la perspective de faire tomber le meilleur ennemi franÃ§ais, et par la mÃªme occasion entretenir le petit espoir de se qualifier pour la Coupe du monde, eux qui en sont privÃ©s depuis 1998. "Pour un tel Ã©vÃ©nement, tout le monde va se dÃ©placer. Il faut s'attendre Ã  quelque chose d'Ã©norme, avec une ambiance assourdissante", prÃ©dit JÃ©rÃ©my Manzorro.

CÃ©dric Bardon connaÃ®t bien le football et les supporters bulgares. "Tous les Ã©lÃ©ments sont rÃ©unis pour que l'ambiance soit Ã©lectrique", explique au HuffPost celui qui a jouÃ© quatre ans Ã  Sofia. Pour l'ancien joueur lyonnais, "les supporters sont trÃ¨s fiers de leur pays, ils sont trÃ¨s prÃ©sents lors de gros matchs comme celui lÃ ." "L'ambiance sera hostile Ã  l'Ã©quipe de France. C'est dans la culture des clubs des pays de l'est", explique-t-il.

Au total, quelques 43.000 supporters se masseront dans les travÃ©es du stade Vasil Levski, du nom du plus grand hÃ©ros national, surnommÃ© "l'ApÃ´tre de la libertÃ©" par le peuple bulgare. Dans cette enceinte symbolique devenue forteresse imprenable, les Bleus devront faire preuve de patience et d'application pour faire un pas de plus vers le Mondial.

Chaos im politischen DeutschlandNach der Wahl herrscht Chaos in der politischen Landschaft: alle sind empÃ¶rt und schockiert Ã¼ber den Wahlsieg der AfD und die Niederlage der Zentrumsparteien.
Es ist kein Wunder, warum so viele von diesen MitbÃ¼rgern sich der AfD zuwenden.
Nur so lÃ¤sst sich die gerade als trostlos bezeichnete Situation - nÃ¤mlich der Einzug der AfD in den Bundestag - meistern.

TEXT:
Thomas Lohnes via Getty Images

Einigkeit und Recht und Freiheit: Genau diese Zeilen gingen mir durch den Kopf am Abend des Wahlsonntags 2017.

Auf die Frage, warum mir die letzte Strophe unserer Nationalhymne in den Sinn kam, kann ich nur kopfschÃ¼ttelnd antworten: weil wir lÃ¤ngst keine Einheit mehr bilden in Deutschland.

Es fÃ¤llt mir schwer zuzugeben, dass der international vorherrschende Populismus die Bundesgrenzen schon lÃ¤ngst passiert hat. Doch noch trauriger ist, dass Jeder dem Anderen die Schuld in die Schuhe schiebt, dem Populismus den Einlass erleichtert zu haben.

Welche Zukunft wollen wir fÃ¼r Deutschland?

Man vergisst jedoch, dass unsere Grenzen lÃ¤ngst undicht waren. Wir sind nicht fÃ¤hig, uns auf einen groÃŸen gemeinsamen Nenner fÃ¼r die Zukunft Deutschlands einig zu werden. Eher zerbrechen wir uns den Kopf Ã¼ber den Brexit und die Aussagen Donald Trumps.

Der grÃ¶ÃŸte gemeinsame Nenner fÃ¼r Deutschland? Wie wÃ¤re es mit einer sicheren Zukunft fÃ¼r unsere Kinder?

WÃ¤hrend die Medien sich im Wahlzeitraum Ã¼ber Erdogans Provokationen echauffierten, nutzte die AfD die Gelegenheit um vermehrt populistische Wahlpropaganda zu betreiben.

NatÃ¼rlich fÃ¼hrte das dazu, dass die Rechtspopulisten den Diskurs in der Medienberichterstattung zu ihren eigenen Gunsten nutzen konnte. Frei nach dem Motto: "Bad news are good news."

Und was haben die etablierten Politiker gemacht? Sie haben sich mitreiÃŸen lassen, wie etwa im TV-Duell Anfang September, und waren unfÃ¤hig, zukunftsfÃ¤hige Wahlversprechen zu machen.

Nach Ãœberzeugungskraft in den Argumenten hat der WÃ¤hler vergebens gesucht, weshalb die Bewohner dieses Landers opportunistisch und trotzig gewÃ¤hlt haben. Beide Eigenschaften schaden dem Gemeinwohl einer Gesellschaft erheblich.

Chaos im politischen Deutschland

Nach der Wahl herrscht Chaos in der politischen Landschaft: alle sind empÃ¶rt und schockiert Ã¼ber den Wahlsieg der AfD und die Niederlage der Zentrumsparteien.

Hinzu kommt die Unruhe innerhalb der etablierten Parteien: Frauke Petry und Marcus Pretzell sind aus der AfD ausgetreten, Seehofer spielte kurz mit dem Gedanken sich von der Schwesterpartei CDU zu trennen und die CSU-Basis will den RÃ¼cktritt Seehofers.

Nur eins mÃ¶chte ich vorne wegnehmen: Dieses Chaos wird durch die Medien ein lautes Echo in der Gesellschaft finden - das sollte uns allen klar sein.

Zu sagen, "Ich gehÃ¶re zu den 87%", bringt uns nichts. Genauso wenig wie auf die MitbÃ¼rger zu schimpfen, die wir leider immer noch als "Ostdeutsche" bezeichnen und damit auszugrenzen.

Es ist kein Wunder, warum so viele von diesen MitbÃ¼rgern sich der AfD zuwenden.

Wir vergrÃ¶ÃŸern damit die Kluft innerhalb der Gesellschaft, was wiederum NÃ¤hrboden fÃ¼r den Populismus birgt. Es hilft uns auch nicht die FlÃ¼chtlinge als Grund allen Ãœbels zu sehen, oder die fehlerhafte Politik der GroÃŸen Koalition verantwortlich dafÃ¼r zu machen.

Einheit heiÃŸt, gemeinsam fÃ¼r das Wohl dieses Landes zu handeln

Kurzum es bringt gerade nichts einen SÃ¼ndenbock ausfindig zu machen, um diesen dann an den Pranger zu stellen, denn Deutschland ist damit nicht geholfen. Wir mÃ¼ssen von der altbewÃ¤hrten Handlungsweise der Marginalisierung absehen.

Sowohl die Gesellschaft, als auch die Medien und die Politik mÃ¼ssen gemeinsam nach Wegen suchen mit der neuen Situation im Bundestag und somit auch in der politischen Landschaft klarzukommen. Nur so lÃ¤sst sich die gerade als trostlos bezeichnete Situation - nÃ¤mlich der Einzug der AfD in den Bundestag - meistern.

Denn Einheit bedeutet fÃ¼r mich gemeinsam, ungeachtet der Herkunft, politischen Ideologie oder Religion, fÃ¼r dieses Land zu handeln. FÃ¼r alles weitere lassen wir die Nationalhymne sprechen:

"Einigkeit und Recht und Freiheit fÃ¼r das deutsche Vaterland! Danach lasst uns alle streben, brÃ¼derlich mit Herz und Hand!

Einigkeit und Recht und Freiheit sind des GlÃ¼ckes Unterpfand: BlÃ¼h im Glanze dieses GlÃ¼ckes, blÃ¼he deutsches Vaterland!"
TITLE: Am Tag der Deutschen Einheit wurde mir klar: Wir sind schon lÃ¤ngst kein geeintes Land mehr

SUMMARY:
President Donald Trump tweeted Monday morning to offer his â€œwarmest condolences and sympathies.â€My warmest condolences and sympathies to the victims and families of the terrible Las Vegas shooting.
â€” Governor Sandoval (@GovSandoval) October 2, 2017Senseless, horrifying act of violence in Las Vegas tonight.
â€œThe thoughts and prayers of politicians are cruelly hollow if they are paired with continued legislative indifference,â€ he said in a statement.
â€” Mike Enzi (@SenatorEnzi) October 2, 2017My heart breaks for Las Vegas - prayers to families and loved ones.
â€” Fla. AG Pam Bondi (@AGPamBondi) October 2, 2017Thoughts & prayers for #LasVegas victims and their family members.
TEXT:
After the deadliest mass shooting in modern U.S. history left at least 58 people dead, plus the gunman, and more than 500 injured at a music festival in Las Vegas late Sunday night, lawmakers responded by offering thoughts and prayers to the victims and their families.

President Donald Trump tweeted Monday morning to offer his â€œwarmest condolences and sympathies.â€

My warmest condolences and sympathies to the victims and families of the terrible Las Vegas shooting. God bless you! â€” Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 2, 2017

Soon after, Vice President Mike Pence tweeted similar sentiments.

To victims, families & loved ones affected by this senseless violence in Las Vegas, Karen & I are praying for you & offering our love... â€” Vice President Pence (@VP) October 2, 2017

...The hearts & prayers of the American people are with you. You have our condolences and sympathies. â€” Vice President Pence (@VP) October 2, 2017

To the courageous first responders, thank you for your acts of bravery. â€” Vice President Pence (@VP) October 2, 2017

In a statement to reporters, White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders affirmed that Trump was being briefed on the situation.

â€œAll of those affected are in our thoughts and prayers,â€ she said.

Nevada lawmakers, including the governor and U.S. senators, expressed their sympathies and affirmed that they were working with local officials to respond to the violence.

A tragic & heinous act of violence has shaken the #Nevada family. Our prayers are w/ the victims & all affected by this act of cowardice. â€” Governor Sandoval (@GovSandoval) October 2, 2017

Senseless, horrifying act of violence in Las Vegas tonight. Praying for all the victims & those impacted by the tragedy. â€” Dean Heller (@SenDeanHeller) October 2, 2017

Spoke with Gov. Sandoval and Attorney General Laxalt and will continue to monitor the situation. â€” Dean Heller (@SenDeanHeller) October 2, 2017

â€œMy thoughts and prayers are with the families of those killed and wounded in last nightâ€™s vicious and senseless attack outside the Mandalay Bay Resort,â€ Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto (D-Nev.) said in a statement, before thanking first responders and offering support to local officials.

A few lawmakers, mostly Democrats, noted the need for more than just thoughts and prayers. Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D-N.Y.) was among them:

This senseless violence must endâ€”thoughts and prayers are simply not enough. We must act to prevent this from happening again. â€” Kirsten Gillibrand (@SenGillibrand) October 2, 2017

Former Rep. Gabby Giffords (D-Ariz.), who was wounded in a mass shooting in 2011, said that â€œno person should endure the horror Las Vegas experienced last night.â€

Heartbroken by the scene our nation is waking up to this morning. No person should endure the horror Las Vegas experienced last night. â€” Gabrielle Giffords (@GabbyGiffords) October 2, 2017

Giffords and her husband, Mark Kelly, who have become prominent gun control advocates, held a press conference on Capitol Hill later in the day, imploring Trump and members of Congress to take action.

â€œWhat weâ€™re hearing today at the Capitol and the White House are thoughts and prayers. Thoughts and prayers are important. We send our thoughts and prayers, too. But they are not enough,â€ Kelly said. â€œYour thoughts and prayers arenâ€™t going to stop the next shooting. Only action and leadership will do that.â€

Sen. Bob Casey (D-Pa.) wrote in a series of tweets that â€œit is not sufficient to just offer thoughts and prayers,â€ and he criticized his colleaguesâ€™ refusal â€œto take real, meaningful action to curb gun violence.â€

Congress must engage in a robust debate about commonsense ways to keep guns, particularly military-style weapons, out of the wrong hands. â€” Senator Bob Casey (@SenBobCasey) October 2, 2017

And Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.), who became a fierce advocate for gun control following the Sandy Hook massacre in 2012, did not mince words.

â€œThe thoughts and prayers of politicians are cruelly hollow if they are paired with continued legislative indifference,â€ he said in a statement. â€œItâ€™s time for Congress to get off its ass and do something.â€

Yet Sanders insisted that it was â€œprematureâ€ to discuss policy changes regarding guns and urged people to wait for â€œall of the facts.â€

â€œThereâ€™s a time and place for a political debate, but now is the time to unite as a country,â€ Sanders said Monday during a White House press briefing, before also offering her â€œthoughts and prayers.â€

See more politiciansâ€™ reactions below.

America woke up to heartbreaking news from Las Vegas. We stand united in our shock, our condolences, & our prayers. https://t.co/dKqjJqPIpu pic.twitter.com/B67cklsBkS â€” Paul Ryan (@SpeakerRyan) October 2, 2017

Keeping #LasVegas in our thoughts this morning after the horrific news. If you're trying to locate missing loved ones, call 1-866-535-5654 â€” Leader McConnell (@SenateMajLdr) October 2, 2017

Horrified and heartbroken by the awful tragedy in #LasVegas last night. Praying for those lost, wounded & waiting for news from loved ones. â€” Nancy Pelosi (@NancyPelosi) October 2, 2017

Such a senseless tragedy in Las Vegas. This horrific act has our nation praying for the victims and their families. May God bless us all. â€” Kevin McCarthy (@GOPLeader) October 2, 2017

Praying for the victims and first responders in Las Vegas and our country right now. This shooting was a horrible and cowardly act. â€” Senator Rand Paul (@RandPaul) October 2, 2017

Lifting up in prayer all impacted by last night's despicable shooting in Las Vegas & all 1st responders on the scene https://t.co/1Yb9NeHx9w â€” Ted Cruz (@tedcruz) October 2, 2017

Our hearts are heavy for the victims of the terrible attack in Las Vegas, their families and for all who have been affected. â€” John Kasich (@JohnKasich) October 2, 2017

Iâ€™m praying for all the victims, their families, and our first responders in the #LasVegas #MandalayBay shooting. â€” Marco Rubio (@marcorubio) October 2, 2017

Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims and their family members affected by the terrible tragedy in #LasVegas. â€” Mike Enzi (@SenatorEnzi) October 2, 2017

My heart breaks for Las Vegas - prayers to families and loved ones. The nation's conscience must be galvanized. â€” Richard Blumenthal (@SenBlumenthal) October 2, 2017

MA is praying for the victims, families & 1st responders in #LasVegas. Deeply saddened & horrified to learn of this senseless mass shooting. â€” Charlie Baker (@MassGovernor) October 2, 2017

Heartbreaking news out of Las Vegasâ€”praying for the victims, their families and our country. â€” Fla. AG Pam Bondi (@AGPamBondi) October 2, 2017

Thoughts & prayers for #LasVegas victims and their family members. What a heartbreaking, horrific tragedy. #PrayForLasVegas â€” Louie Gohmert (@replouiegohmert) October 2, 2017

Praying for the victims and their loved ones following the horrific shooting in Las Vegas - and grateful to all the brave first responders. â€” Sen. Maggie Hassan (@SenatorHassan) October 2, 2017
TITLE: Politicians Offer Thoughts And Prayers After Deadliest Mass Shooting In Modern U.S. History

Donald Trump hat wieder einmal Nordkorea gedroht - und einmal mehr war seine Drohung so kryptisch, dass die Welt rÃ¤tselt, was der US-PrÃ¤sident eigentlich meinte.

Via Twitter bekrÃ¤ftigte er am Samstagnachmittag (Ortszeit) seine Ansicht, dass GesprÃ¤che mit dem nordkoreanischen Regime Ã¼ber die Einstellung des Atomprogramms Zeitverschwendung seien. Presidents and their administrations have been talking to North Korea for 25 years, agreements made and massive amounts of money paid......

"Hat nicht funktioniert", kommentierte Trump. "Vereinbarungen wurden verletzt, bevor die Tinte trocken war, USA-UnterhÃ¤ndler wurden zum Narren gehalten. Tut mir leid, aber nur eine Sache wird funktionieren!"

SUMMARY:
JONES MILLS, Pa. â€” A Pennsylvania man says he used flashing dashboard lights to mimic a police speed trap â€” but only so he could slow down vehicles speeding past his rural home and killing deer and endangering people.
Fifty-seven-year-old Ricky McMillen tells WPXI-TV that he used the flashing lights on his car because he's been complaining about speeders for years and getting few results.
What he says he has gotten is very smelly deer carcasses along the road in Donegal Township, about 50 miles southeast of Pittsburgh.
State police charged McMillen on Thursday with impersonating a public servant and displaying improper lights.
McMillen says he's been using the lights for a while and they've worked well.
TEXT:
JONES MILLS, Pa. â€” A Pennsylvania man says he used flashing dashboard lights to mimic a police speed trap â€” but only so he could slow down vehicles speeding past his rural home and killing deer and endangering people.

Fifty-seven-year-old Ricky McMillen tells WPXI-TV that he used the flashing lights on his car because he's been complaining about speeders for years and getting few results. What he says he has gotten is very smelly deer carcasses along the road in Donegal Township, about 50 miles southeast of Pittsburgh.

State police charged McMillen on Thursday with impersonating a public servant and displaying improper lights.

McMillen says he's been using the lights for a while and they've worked well.

McMillen has been mailed a summons to appear for a preliminary hearing Dec. 15.

___

Information from: WPXI-TV, http://www.wpxi.com
TITLE: Pennsylvania Man Ricky McMillen Set Up Fake Speed Trap Because Of Smelly Deer Carcasses

SUMMARY:
EMPICS Entertainment Stanley Johnson warns that Brexit could force UK farmers to lower standards to compete with US market.
Fox slammed the media for being â€œobsessedâ€ with the issue after he was challenged to eat chlorine-washed chicken to show he was comfortable with the product entering the UK food market.
A vast array of institutions and scientific infrastructure keeps UK food fit to eat.
Yet both Falkenberg and Johnson admit that animal welfare and farming practices arenâ€™t always at the top of politiciansâ€™ agendas.
A spokesperson said in a statement to HuffPost UK: â€œAny future trade deal must work for UK farmers, businesses, and consumers.
TEXT:
There have been fresh warnings that Brexit could lead to British farming and food standards being lowered if meat from the United States is allowed to flood UK supermarkets.

The claims, which have been backed by passionate animal welfare advocate and former Tory MEP Stanley Johnson, come amid a conference this week of international agriculture and livestock experts in London.

Experts have said that Brexit could see a race to the bottom for Britainâ€™s food quality in the interests of completing free trade deals with countries like the United States, and that food safety standards faced â€œserious risksâ€ if the UK failed to adopt EU-style rules.

This follows previous warnings that rules around hormone-injected meat, chlorinated chicken, milk containing antibiotics and genetically modified vegetables could be weakened after the country severs ties with the European Union, which currently offers protections against such products.

EMPICS Entertainment Stanley Johnson warns that Brexit could force UK farmers to lower standards to compete with US market.

Johnson, who also revealed he now backs his son Boris on Brexit, told HuffPost UK it would be easy for Britain to go down the mass production route seen in the US.

â€œJust how animal friendly are some of these intensive rearing techniques... which result in cattle never getting out of the feed lot at all? I would be worried that, once weâ€™re out of the EU, people will say â€˜ok we can get American beefâ€™.

â€œIâ€™m worried about importing quantities of beef which we know for a fact come from establishments where these animals simply donâ€™t have a decent life, where you have got thousands and thousands of animals packed in,â€ he told HuffPost UK.

Iâ€™m worried about importing quantities of beef which we know for a fact come from establishments where these animals simply donâ€™t have a decent life Stanley Johnson

Johnson added that cheap meat from the US could also lead to farmers in the UK being forced to compete with food giants across the Atlantic: â€œI would be very worried that, as a result of letting that happen we then have increasing pressure in this country, because of competition reasons, to say â€˜we must do that ourselves now, go down this mass production routeâ€™.â€

International trade secretary Liam Fox has repeatedly talked up the benefits of free trade deals with countries such as the US and Canada after the UK leaves the EU.

But there was outrage in Britain this summer after it was revealed that chlorine-washed chicken, which is legal in the US, could enter the UK food chain in order to facilitate a trade deal with Washington.

Fox slammed the media for being â€œobsessedâ€ with the issue after he was challenged to eat chlorine-washed chicken to show he was comfortable with the product entering the UK food market.

PA Wire/PA Images The practice of washing chicken in chlorine, common in the US but banned in the UK under EU regulations, has sparked concern.

Under current EU regulations, poultry meat which is rinsed in chlorine is banned, but after the UK leaves the EU it will be up to the government whether a ban stays in place.

Tim Lang, professor of food policy at City University in London, has previously warned that Brexit could see a race to the bottom in terms of food quality.

He told the Compassion in World Farmingâ€™s Extinction and Livestock international conference on Friday: â€œWe in Britain are currently away with the fairies, because of Brexit we are throwing everything into the air like children throwing toys out of the pram.

â€œBeware, intellectually and in principle we might get improvements from it (Brexit), but the likelihood of that is very low, because at the moment the food culture in Britain is based around price. The schemes to go for ever cheaper food will triumph over higher values.â€

Brexit campaigners did not inform consumers/voters that US agribusiness is salivating at the prospect of selling foods which have weaker standards Tim Lang, Professor of Food Policy at City, University of London

In a University of Sussex report co-authored by Lang in July, experts warned there were â€œserious risks that standards for food safety will decline if the UK ceases to adopt EU safety rules and instead accepts free-trade agreements with countries with significantly weaker standardsâ€.

In addition to weaker standards in countries like China, the report also identified the US, warning: â€œUnder the Trump administration US standards are likely to decline sharply.â€

It continues: â€œBrexit campaigners ignored the inbuilt reliance the UK has on pan-European institutions, to which we contribute. A vast array of institutions and scientific infrastructure keeps UK food fit to eat.

â€œBrexit campaigners did not inform consumers/voters that US agribusiness is salivating at the prospect of selling foods which have weaker standards, nor that foods derived on world markets use standards which are weaker than the EUâ€™s and those of the USA.â€

Examples of food practices used in the US, which are currently banned in the EU: Hormones Many beef producers in the US use implants of synthetic hormones under the skin of their beef cattle in order to promote growth, requiring the animals to need less food but still grow at a fast pace. The US says meat from hormone-treated cattle is safe, but the EU disagrees, citing the posed risks to vulnerable groups, such as pregnant women and people with weak immune systems. Bovine somatotropin in dairy cows In the US, many dairy cows are injected regularly with a synthetic hormone called bovine growth hormone (BGH). In the UK and the EU the hormone is called recombinant bovine somatotropin (rBST). The growth hormone is used to to increase milk yield but it can cause mastitis in cattle, which is an inflammation of the udder that derives from a bacterial infection. This can lead to more antibiotics being given to the cows. The EUâ€™s Scientific Committee on Animal Health found that the practice led to â€œvery significantly poorer welfare because of increased foot disorders, mastitis, reproductive disorders and other production related diseasesâ€. GM crops and animals More varieties of GM crops are allowed to be produced and sold in the US than in the EU. GM foods are not currently grown commercially in the UK, but they can be imported. In the EU, if a food contains or consists of genetically modified organisms (GMOs), or contains ingredients produced from GMOs, this must be indicated on the label. In the US there is no mandatory labelling requirement. Chlorinated chicken Poultry dipped in chlorinated disinfectant hit the headlines in the UK this summer. In the USA, in an attempt to combat problems of microbiological contamination of poultry meat, manufacturers are required to dip the meat in disinfectant, which most commonly is a chlorine-based product. The practice is not lawful in the EU or the UK and in the US poultry meat is not labelled as having been dipped in disinfectant.

According to the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, more than 99% of farm animals in the US are raised in factory farms.

Speaking about factory farming, which can see tens of thousands of animals crammed into one warehouse, Johnson said: â€œI wouldnâ€™t want that to come back on the agenda merely because the Americans are able to sell their stuff over hereâ€.

He also warned about UK policies possibly being swayed by US food giants in the future.

â€œNever underestimate the political influence of the big agricultural business ... they will ... take whatever advantages they find they can take.â€

roibu via Getty Images Inside a poultry farm.

As part of the EU Withdrawal Bill, all existing EU legislation will be copied across into domestic UK law after March 2019.

This means there is unlikely to be an immediate impact on much of Britainâ€™s industries, including farming, straight after leaving the EU.

Karl Falkenberg, a former adviser to president of the European Commission Jean-Claude Juncker, served as deputy director general for trade in Brussels for five years before becoming director general for environment between 2009 and 2015.

He told HuffPost that the EUâ€™s extensive food product legislation has been heavily criticised by the US in the past: â€œIn the United States GMOs (Genetically Modified Organisms) are common practice, hormone addition in producing meat is absolutely normal practice.

â€œWe have decided that these are things that we donâ€™t want to have in the European Union and therefore we have legislation that protects this.

â€œBut when you leave the European Union, again you become free to modify those conditions, if you so want.â€

That isnâ€™t a level playing field, that isnâ€™t an equal opportunity, that is the economics of the madhouse that will lead to us simply sucking in foods from other parts of the world produced to different standards Guy Smith, vice president of the National Farmers Union

Guy Smith, vice president of the National Farmers Union, claimed last month that free trade was a â€œmythâ€ as so many countries subsidise their agricultural sectors.

â€œThat isnâ€™t a level playing field, that isnâ€™t an equal opportunity, that is the economics of the madhouse that will lead to us simply sucking in foods from other parts of the world produced to different standards.

â€œWe donâ€™t think thatâ€™s a very sensible scenario for anyone to just sign up to some ideological idea that free trade actually exists where I donâ€™t think it does.â€ If the UKâ€™s food safety standards do not meet the EUâ€™s requirements, then exports from the UK to the European bloc would also be affected.

However, if the UK increases its food standards to a point that exceeds European Union guidelines, then it would be up to the EU to meet those requirements if it wants to sell to the British market.

Extinction and Livestock Karl Falkenberg speaking at Compassion in World Farming's Extinction and Livestock Conference.

Yet both Falkenberg and Johnson admit that animal welfare and farming practices arenâ€™t always at the top of politiciansâ€™ agendas.

Environment secretary Michael Gove told a party conference fringe meeting he was aware of concerns and was committed to ensuring animal welfare standards in the UK do not slip after Brexit.

The Tory minister said: â€œOutside the European Unionâ€™s single market, we can improve animal welfare, supporting more humane methods of farming and restricting the live export of animals.â€

And while Johnson praised Goveâ€™s goal to restrict live animal exports, he said Theresa Mayâ€™s government isnâ€™t doing enough about sustainable farming.

The Government said that maintaining safety and public confidence in food available in the UK â€œis of the highest priorityâ€.

A spokesperson said in a statement to HuffPost UK: â€œAny future trade deal must work for UK farmers, businesses, and consumers.

â€œAny new products wishing to enter the UK market must comply with our rigorous legislation and standards â€“ we will not compromise on animal welfare and food safety.â€

Unlike his son, who was one of the main driving forces behind the Leave campaign, the Johnson was a staunch Remain supporter.

In the run-up to the European Referendum last year, the 77-year-old founded and co-chaired Environmentalists for Europe.

He said: â€œMy position in the run up to the referendum I said letâ€™s stay in.. because the gain is not only the gain in animal welfare in Britain but is the gain in terms of animal welfare throughout Europe as a whole.

â€œI think this whole question of chlorinate chicken, for example, was an issueâ€¦ I mean certainly if you look at the way chickens are raised in the United States you do have to say to yourself, â€˜look, come on, are we really talking about humane treatment of animals?â€™.â€

In 2014, there were more than 23 billion chickens, turkeys, geese, ducks and guinea fowl on the planet â€“ more than three per person, WWFâ€™s latest report Appetite for Destruction revealed this week.
TITLE: How Brexit Could Force UK Farmers To Lower Standards To Compete With US Meat Market

La eyaculaciÃ³n femenina surge en las glÃ¡ndulas parauretrales, que se encuentran en los tejidos esponjosos que rodean la uretra", aclara.
El punto G estÃ¡, supuestamente, entre 5 y 8 centÃ­metros en el interior de la vagina, en la pared vaginal frontal.
Tracey CoxTracey Cox, sexÃ³loga y experta en relaciones, indica que el punto G "estÃ¡, supuestamente, entre 5 y 8 centÃ­metros en el interior de la vagina, en la pared vaginal frontal".
El punto G suele estar en la pared vaginal frontal, entre la abertura vaginal y el cuello del Ãºtero.
Y concluye: "El hecho de que la gente crea o no crea en el punto G no importa realmente.
TEXT:
La ciencia lleva aÃ±os pregonando la importancia del punto G para alcanzar el orgasmo femenino, pero parece que mucha gente aÃºn no sabe dÃ³nde se encuentra.

De hecho, esta es la pregunta sobre sexo mÃ¡s repetida en el buscador de Google entre adultos de 18 a 65 aÃ±os, segÃºn demuestra un estudio de Durex, que tambiÃ©n revela que mÃ¡s de un tercio (un 34%) de los jÃ³venes de entre 18 y 24 aÃ±os no tiene confianza para hablar sobre sexo. De ahÃ­ que acudan en masa a buscar respuestas en Internet.

Por todo ello, la ediciÃ³n britÃ¡nica del HuffPost se ha puesto en contacto con varias expertas para llegar al fondo del asunto.

SegÃºn Alix Fox, experta de Durex, el punto G es la forma reducida de decir "punto GrÃ¤fenberg", nombre que toma del ginecÃ³logo alemÃ¡n que empezÃ³ a investigar sobre ello en los aÃ±os 50.

"Los cientÃ­ficos no se ponen de acuerdo en si el punto G existe como una estructura anatÃ³mica real (como un clÃ­toris interno) o si es simplemente una zona especialmente sensible para muchas mujeres", seÃ±ala. "Lo que sÃ­ que se sabe con certeza es que estimular esa zona produce placer y puede llevar a las mujeres a tener orgasmos maravillosos".

No todas las mujeres tienen un punto G, pero el 60% de ellas sÃ­. Annabelle Knight

Annabelle Knight, sexÃ³loga y experta en relaciones de Lovehoney, se encuentra entre quienes aseguran que el punto G es muy real: "Ha habido estudios que han puesto en entredicho su existencia, pero ya han sido sobradamente refutados. No todas las mujeres tienen un punto G, pero el 60% de ellas sÃ­".

Aunque se suele hablar del punto G como una clave para que la mujer llegue al orgasmo, Samantha Evans, dueÃ±a del sex shop Jo Divine, asegura que no es lo Ãºnico que lo puede provocar: "Cuando se estimula el punto G, la mujer puede sentir como si necesitara hacer pipÃ­, y por eso algunas mujeres reniegan de esa sensaciÃ³n, que confunden con las ganas de orinar".

"Esa la sensaciÃ³n que viene antes de la eyaculaciÃ³n femenina. Algunas mujeres eyaculan cuando estimulan su punto G, algo que mejora la experiencia. La eyaculaciÃ³n femenina surge en las glÃ¡ndulas parauretrales, que se encuentran en los tejidos esponjosos que rodean la uretra", aclara.

Â¿DÃ³nde estÃ¡ el punto G?

No hay consenso a la hora de situar la zona exacta en la que estÃ¡ el punto G, aunque estas expertas coinciden en seÃ±alar que las mujeres tienden a sentir mÃ¡s placer en la pared vaginal frontal.

El punto G estÃ¡, supuestamente, entre 5 y 8 centÃ­metros en el interior de la vagina, en la pared vaginal frontal. Tracey Cox

Tracey Cox, sexÃ³loga y experta en relaciones, indica que el punto G "estÃ¡, supuestamente, entre 5 y 8 centÃ­metros en el interior de la vagina, en la pared vaginal frontal". "La zona del punto G sobresale ligeramente, pero solo cuando las glÃ¡ndulas que estÃ¡n en torno a la uretra se hinchan", especifica.

Sin embargo, la experta hace hincapiÃ© que la localizaciÃ³n exacta del punto G varÃ­a dependiendo de cada mujer.

Knight sugiere que las mujeres se lo encuentren ellas mismas antes de intentar estimularlo con sus parejas: "La forma mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil de localizar el punto G de cada una es tumbarse de espaldas e introducir el dedo corazÃ³n en la vagina. El punto G suele estar en la pared vaginal frontal, entre la abertura vaginal y el cuello del Ãºtero. DeberÃ­a ser un poco rugoso, casi como la superficie de una nuez".

Â¿CÃ³mo se puede estimular el punto G?

SegÃºn Tracey Cox, en general las parejas prefieren estimular la pared vaginal entera en vez de buscar un escurridizo botÃ³n de placer que quizÃ¡s exista o quizÃ¡s no: "La tÃ©cnica habitual para estimular el punto G de tu pareja es meter los dedos y curvarlos hacia arriba como si estuvieras haciendo un gesto de 'ven aquÃ­".

Knight aÃ±ade que algunos hombres tienen una ligera curvatura en el pene erecto que puede ayudar a estimular la pared vaginal frontal.

"Las mujeres pueden sacarle partido a esa curvatura escogiendo una postura que favorezca que su pene impacte con el punto G al penetrar", seÃ±ala. "Si tiene un pene recto, tambiÃ©n hay posturas que maximizan las posibilidades de estimular el punto G". "La mariposa es una buena opciÃ³n. Te recuestas en una mesa mientras Ã©l, de pie, te penetra. Te tiene que agarrar bajo las caderas para que pueda sujetarte bien. Esta posiciÃ³n deberÃ­a servir para dirigir su pene directamente a tu punto G", propone.

Â¿CÃ³mo me puedo estimular el punto G yo misma?

Samantha Evans asegura que una de las mejores formas de estimular el punto G es utilizar un juguete sexual curvado, algo para lo que no hace falta tener compaÃ±Ã­a: "PruÃ©balo a lo largo de todo el mes, ya que los cambios hormonales que se producen en tu cuerpo pueden tener un efecto positivo en tus niveles de sensibilidad y excitaciÃ³n sexual".

"Date primero un masaje vulvar o anal y, cuando veas que empiezas a estar suficientemente excitada para tener un orgasmo, o justo cuando acabes de tener uno, mÃ©tete el dedo corazÃ³n en la vagina y cÃºrvalo haciendo el gesto de 'ven aquÃ­' para acariciar la pared frontal", plantea.

"Busca entre 3 y 6 centÃ­metros en el interior de la vagina y presiona con firmeza. La zona del punto G se nota rugosa y se estimula con mÃ¡s presiÃ³n que el clÃ­toris".

"Mueve los dedos por la zona y prueba distintos tipos de contacto. Intenta ver a travÃ©s de la piel y percibir cÃ³mo va cambiando el tono muscular", aÃ±ade.

Todas las expertas con las que ha contactado el HuffPost han subrayado tambiÃ©n que, ya sea un "botÃ³n" de placer o simplemente una zona mÃ¡s sensible, prestarle demasiada atenciÃ³n puede provocar el efecto contrario al deseado.

"No te obsesiones con tener un punto G, limÃ­tate a disfrutar de las sensaciones placenteras del sexo", recuerda Evans. Y concluye: "El hecho de que la gente crea o no crea en el punto G no importa realmente. Lo que de verdad importa es disfrutar del fantÃ¡stico placer del sexo".

Este artÃ­culo fue publicado originalmente en el 'HuffPost' Reino Unido y ha sido traducido del inglÃ©s por Daniel Templeman Sauco y retomado por HuffPost MÃ©xico.
TITLE: DÃ³nde estÃ¡ el punto G y cÃ³mo provocar el orgasmo y la eyaculaciÃ³n femenina

TEXT:
C'est bien beau de vouloir apporter son dÃ©jeuner toute la semaine mais, concrÃ¨tement, que va-t-on manger? J'ai rÃ©flÃ©chi Ã  des recettes pas trop difficiles, rapides et qui permettent de recycler certains plats que l'on mange chez soi.

Dans la mesure du possible, j'ai essayÃ© de composer avec des lÃ©gumes cuits et crus, des protÃ©ines animales et/ou vÃ©gÃ©tales, des fÃ©culents, un laitage, un fruit frais ou cuit.

VoilÃ  donc Ã  quoi va ressembler ma semaine de dÃ©jeuners faits-maison:

Lundi 9 octobre: cuisiner les restes du poulet du dimanche

On a toujours besoin de deux cuillÃ¨res en bois pour faire un bon poulet rÃ´ti.

Pour cuisiner les restes de poulet rÃ´ti du dimanche midi, je prÃ©pare une mini quiche poireau et poulet. Vous pouvez la faire en version normale en triplant les quantitÃ©s. Elle se congÃ¨le trÃ¨s bien. Elle sera accompagnÃ©e d'une salade de carottes rÃ¢pÃ©es. En dessert, ce sera du fromage blanc et une pomme.

Faites prÃ©chauffer votre four Ã  180Â°C. Effilochez l'Ã©quivalent d'un blanc de poulet. Coupez le poireau en fines rondelles, faites revenir Ã  la poÃªle pendant cinq minutes dans un peu d'huile d'olive, salez, poivrez. Dans un saladier battez les Å“ufs, mÃ©langez le lait, ajoutez de la noix de la muscade si vous avez, salez, poivrez. Ã‰talez la pÃ¢te feuilletÃ©e, piquez-la, versez les rondelles de poireau, ajoutez le poulet et versez par-dessus le mÃ©lange lait - Å“uf. Parsemez de gruyÃ¨re et enfournez pendant 15 minutes. Pendant ce temps-lÃ , rÃ¢pez deux carottes. Pour l'assaisonnement, une vinaigrette classique: moutarde, vinaigre, huile d'olive.

Mardi 10 octobre: pimper ses pÃ¢tes pour le lendemain midi

Lundi soir, c'est un bon plat de pÃ¢tes qui m'attend. J'en fais un peu plus pour pouvoir les transformer pour le repas de mardi en gratin en m'inspirant d'une recette du livre "Pasta cake" de Christelle Huet-Gomez aux Ã©ditions Marabout. Du fromage blanc et une poire en dessert.

Faites prÃ©chauffer votre four Ã  180Â°C. Coupez la feta en dÃ©s, les olives en rondelle et les cÅ“urs d'artichaut en deux. MÃ©langez le tout avec les pÃ¢tes cuites Ã  la sauce tomate. Salez, poivrez. Versez dans un moule, parsemez de gruyÃ¨re et enfournez pendant 15 minutes.

Lavez de la roquette, finissez la vinaigrette de la veille.

Mercredi 11 octobre: faire une salade presque comme au resto libanais

Ã‡a devrait ressembler Ã  un truc de ce genre pour mercredi midi.

Ce mercredi, je suis sÃ»re que je vais commencer Ã  flÃ©chir et Ã  rÃªver d'un bon traiteur libanais pour ma pause dÃ©jeuner. On fait donc un repas froid, simple, inspirÃ© d'une recette du livre "Simplissime Salades ComplÃ¨tes" de Jean-FranÃ§ois Mallet chez Hachette Cuisine.

MÃ©langez un avocat coupÃ© en morceaux, le concombre en bÃ¢tonnets, des miettes de thon, le jus d'un demi citron, les pois chiches rincÃ©s et Ã©gouttÃ©s. Ã‰pluchez et coupez en fines rondelles l'oignon rouge. Ciselez du persil, de la coriandre, de la menthe selon votre goÃ»t (ajoutez-les au dernier moment). A cÃ´tÃ©, un peu de houmous et du pain pita.

En dessert, du raisin.

Jeudi 12 octobre: rÃ©ussir des wraps aussi instagrammables que bons

Tout pareil mais sans le poulet, sans la tomate, sans les Ã©pinards et sans l'emballage.

VoilÃ  qui va nous permettre de finir pas mal de choses utilisÃ©es plus tÃ´t dans la semaine: les artichauts, les herbes aromatiques, l'oignon rouge, du houmous, de l'avocat, de la salade.

Dans une tortilla, mettez une bonne quantitÃ© de houmous, coupez l'avocat en tranches, Ã©gouttez les artichauts, coupez-en deux, dÃ©coupez l'oignon en fines tranches, ajoutez de la salade. Roulez l'ensemble et dÃ©coupez-le en tronÃ§on, piquez d'un cure-dent. Si vous craignez d'avoir faim, ajoutez des blancs de poulet.

En dessert : une compote de poire et pomme au micro-ondes du bureau. Coupez les deux fruits en petits morceaux. Placez un plat adaptÃ© au micro-ondes et faites chauffer pendant deux fois huit minutes. MÃ©langez au milieu.

Vendredi 13 octobre: vendredi c'est veggie

Et on termine en beautÃ© avec un dahl express de lentilles corail, avec une bonne salade et du pain pita. Pour la recette, je me suis inspirÃ©e de celle-ci sur le blog Papilles et pupilles.

Ã‰pluchez et pressez (ou coupez le plus petit possible) une gousse d'ail, coupez l'oignon trÃ¨s finement. Dans une grande poÃªle, versez un peu d'huile d'olive, mettez l'ail, l'oignon, une cuillÃ¨re Ã  cafÃ© de gingembre (frais ou en poudre), deux brins de thym. AprÃ¨s 5 minutes ajoutez le concentrÃ© de tomate, du piment (si vous aimez Ã§a!) et une cuillÃ¨re Ã  cafÃ© de garam massala, ce mÃ©lange d'Ã©pices indiennes que vous trouverez Ã  cÃ´tÃ©s des currys.

Versez 140g de lentilles crues, ajoutez 450ml d'eau. Laissez mijoter une douzaine de minutes. PrÃ©voyez un peu de coriandre fraÃ®che Ã  ciseler au-dessus.

En dessert, du fromage blanc et ce qu'il reste de fruit.

Victoire, nous sommes les kings et queens du dÃ©jeuner fait maison.

TEXT:
LIFESTYLE

Watch: This Deep Breathing Technique Helps To Calm You Down

When people are anxious before getting surgery doctors and nurses often tell them to take slow, deep breaths with long exhalations. It may seem like an inadequate way to quell anxiety, but in many cases, it actually works.

SUMMARY:
If you've had a baby in the past 15 years, you've likely had someone whisper these three little words to you as you stood helpless in the face of your baby's crying.
The phrase, which comes from Dr. Harvey Karp's The Happiest Baby on the Block, is part of the pediatrician's regimen for calming babies and helping them get to sleep happily.

the baby burrito), "side" (holding a baby on their side or over your shoulder), "shush" (just like it sounds .. or alternatively, white noise), "swing" (rocking a baby firmly for movement) and "suck" (if you've ever seen a pacifier work its magic on a newborn, you know what this is about).
